definition.text: this category encompasses services focused on the cleaning and maintenance of various objects and environments, ensuring cleanliness and hygiene across different settings. It includes processes aimed at maintaining the aesthetic and functional quality of items, surfaces, and spaces. The activities within this classification are distinguished by their specific purposes, such as the upkeep of cleanliness in residential, commercial, and industrial contexts, as well as specialized care for textiles and vehicles. Additionally, it involves pest control measures to ensure a safe and healthy environment. This classification supports a range of cleaning services that prioritize the effective management of cleanliness and sanitation, contributing to the overall upkeep of facilities and assets.

this classification pertains to services focused on the ongoing upkeep and sanitation of various indoor and semi-indoor environments. It encompasses activities aimed at maintaining cleanliness and hygiene in spaces that are frequently utilized for professional, communal, or personal activities. The scope includes routine cleaning tasks that ensure surfaces and areas remain tidy and presentable, as well as specialized preparations for flooring that enhance the overall cleanliness and functionality of the environment. The classification also addresses the cleaning of communal and office spaces, sanitary areas, kitchenettes, and circulation zones, emphasizing the importance of regular maintenance to uphold health standards and aesthetic appeal in these settings.

a category focused on the fundamental cleaning processes aimed at maintaining the cleanliness and hygiene of various surfaces and environments. This includes routine tasks that ensure the removal of dirt, dust, and contaminants from floors, walls, and other surfaces to preserve their condition and appearance. The activities involved are typically less specialized than those associated with specific cleaning environments and can encompass a broad range of cleaning techniques and products suitable for general maintenance purposes. The emphasis is on sustaining a clean and orderly space to promote a healthy environment.

this category encompasses activities and processes aimed at the preparation and maintenance of flooring surfaces to ensure optimal cleanliness and functionality. It includes specialized cleaning methods and products designed to remove dirt, stains, and debris from various types of flooring materials. The focus is on maintaining the integrity and appearance of the flooring while preparing it for subsequent use or treatment. This may involve the use of specific tools and techniques tailored to different flooring types, ensuring adherence to health and safety standards. The classification is distinct from other cleaning activities that target specific environments or types of cleaning tasks.

this classification encompasses services specifically aimed at the upkeep and sanitation of office and conference room environments. It includes activities such as dusting, vacuuming, mopping, and disinfecting surfaces to ensure a clean and hygienic workspace. The focus is on maintaining a professional appearance and a healthy atmosphere for occupants, distinguishing it from other maintenance cleaning services that target different areas or functions within a facility. The scope may also cover the cleaning of furniture, electronic equipment, and other fixtures commonly found in office and conference settings.

this classification encompasses spaces specifically designed for personal hygiene and sanitation that require specialized maintenance cleaning. It includes areas equipped with fixtures such as sinks, toilets, and showers, which necessitate thorough cleaning and sanitization to ensure hygiene standards are met. This category is distinct from other cleaning classifications that focus on different types of environments or cleaning needs, emphasizing the unique requirements and practices involved in the upkeep of sanitary facilities. The classification recognizes the importance of maintaining cleanliness in these areas to promote health and safety.

a category that encompasses products and services specifically designed for the maintenance and cleaning of kitchenette areas. This classification includes items and tasks that address the unique cleaning needs of spaces where food and beverages are prepared and served, ensuring hygiene and functionality. It differentiates itself from other cleaning categories by focusing on the requirements of kitchenette environments, which may involve the use of specialized cleaning agents, tools, and techniques tailored to handle food-related residues, appliances, surfaces, and fixtures commonly found in such areas.

this category encompasses areas designated for movement and access within various facilities, specifically focusing on their maintenance and cleanliness. It includes the practices and procedures involved in the upkeep of hallways, corridors, and other transit spaces, ensuring they are free from debris, well-maintained, and hygienic. The activities associated with this category are distinct from those targeting basic cleaning tasks, preparation of flooring surfaces, maintenance of office and conference areas, upkeep of sanitary facilities, and care of kitchenette spaces. This classification emphasizes the importance of maintaining circulation areas to support overall cleanliness and functionality in a variety of environments.
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

this classification encompasses activities and services specifically aimed at the cleaning of glass surfaces and building facades. It includes techniques and products designed to maintain the clarity and aesthetic appeal of glass, as well as the removal of dirt, grime, and other contaminants from exterior building surfaces. The focus is on ensuring that these surfaces are not only clean but also safe and visually appealing. This category is distinct from other cleaning services that address maintenance, industrial settings, vehicles, pest control, textiles, external facilities, and gardening services, which serve different cleaning needs and environments.
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

a category encompassing products and services specifically designed for the cleaning and maintenance of glass surfaces. This includes various formulations and tools that effectively remove dirt, grime, streaks, and other contaminants from glass materials, ensuring clarity and shine. The offerings may range from liquid cleaners, sprays, and wipes to specialized equipment intended for both residential and commercial applications. Emphasis is placed on solutions that are safe for glass and compatible with various environmental conditions, distinguishing these cleaning methods from those used for other surfaces.

a specific cleaning service focused on the exterior surfaces of buildings, typically involving the removal of dirt, grime, and pollutants from facades. This process is designed to enhance the aesthetic appeal and longevity of the building materials while maintaining safety standards. It may utilize various techniques and equipment, including pressure washing, chemical cleaners, and specialized tools, to effectively clean surfaces made from materials such as glass, metal, and stone. This service is distinct from other cleaning services that may concentrate solely on glass surfaces, as it encompasses a broader range of facade materials and cleaning methods.

this classification encompasses methods and products specifically designed for the thorough cleaning of industrial environments and facilities. It includes practices aimed at maintaining hygiene and operational efficiency in settings where heavy machinery, production equipment, and large-scale operations are prevalent. The focus is on ensuring cleanliness in areas such as manufacturing plants, warehouses, and other industrial spaces, addressing unique challenges such as the removal of industrial residues, contaminants, and dirt build-up. Techniques and tools categorized here are tailored for rigorous cleaning tasks, often requiring specialized knowledge and equipment to achieve optimal results. The classification distinctly separates these cleaning practices from those aimed at general maintenance, external surfaces, vehicles, textiles, or pest control, emphasizing their specialized nature in industrial contexts.

this classification encompasses services and products specifically designed for the cleaning and maintenance of production facilities. It includes methods, equipment, and materials tailored to ensure hygiene and cleanliness in environments where industrial processes take place. The focus is on maintaining operational efficiency and safety standards by removing residues, contaminants, and debris that may affect production quality. This classification distinguishes itself by addressing the unique cleaning requirements associated with production settings, differentiating it from more general or surface-level cleaning solutions.

this classification encompasses a range of products and services specifically designed for the effective cleaning of industrial environments. It includes solutions that are targeted at maintaining cleanliness in various industrial settings, ensuring compliance with hygiene standards and operational efficiency. The offerings may involve a variety of cleaning agents, equipment, and methodologies tailored for heavy-duty cleaning tasks. This category is distinct from other classifications that focus on specific cleaning areas or applications, thereby highlighting the general nature of cleaning solutions that can be applied across multiple industrial contexts.

a category that encompasses various types of floor cleaning solutions and practices specifically designed for industrial environments. This classification focuses on methods and products aimed at maintaining cleanliness and hygiene on industrial flooring surfaces, ensuring safety and compliance with industry standards. It includes specialized equipment, cleaning agents, and techniques tailored for different flooring types commonly found in industrial settings. The offerings in this category are distinct from those aimed at other cleaning tasks within the industrial sector, emphasizing the unique requirements and challenges associated with floor maintenance in these environments.

this classification encompasses services and activities specifically focused on the cleaning of internal surfaces within industrial environments. It pertains to the maintenance and hygiene of facilities, ensuring that interiors are free from contaminants and meet operational standards. This category includes specialized cleaning processes, equipment, and techniques tailored to the unique requirements of industrial settings, which may involve various materials and surfaces. The aim is to enhance the cleanliness, safety, and functionality of the space, thereby supporting overall operational efficiency and compliance with health and safety regulations.

a controlled environment designed to minimize the presence of airborne particulate matter, ensuring optimal conditions for sensitive processes or products. This space undergoes specialized cleaning procedures to maintain cleanliness standards that prevent contamination. The cleaning methods and equipment used are tailored to preserve the integrity of materials and equipment within the area, adhering to strict guidelines that address air quality, surface cleanliness, and overall hygiene. This classification encompasses practices and tools specifically intended for maintaining the cleanliness and operational efficiency of environments where dust control is crucial, distinguishing it from other forms of industrial cleaning that may not focus on such stringent cleanliness requirements.

a category dedicated to machines specifically designed for the engineering and execution of cleaning tasks within various building environments. These machines are utilized to maintain hygiene and cleanliness in industrial settings, focusing on efficient removal of dirt, debris, and contaminants from surfaces and structures. They are distinct from other cleaning machines as they cater to specialized cleaning operations, ensuring compliance with industry standards for cleanliness and safety. This classification encompasses a range of equipment tailored for rigorous cleaning applications, often incorporating advanced technologies and features to enhance performance and effectiveness in maintaining optimal environmental conditions in industrial facilities.

a category focused on specialized services aimed at the thorough cleaning of containers used in various industrial processes. This service ensures that containers are free from contaminants, residues, and any harmful substances that could compromise product integrity or safety. The cleaning processes may involve the use of advanced techniques and equipment tailored to address the specific requirements of different container types, including those used for storage, transportation, or manufacturing. The objective is to maintain high standards of hygiene and compliance with industry regulations, thereby supporting operational efficiency and product quality in industrial settings.

a category of items specifically designed for the purpose of cleaning machinery and equipment used in industrial settings. These products are engineered to effectively remove contaminants, residues, and debris from various types of machines, ensuring optimal performance and hygiene. Their application is crucial in maintaining the efficiency and longevity of industrial machinery, as well as in adhering to safety and cleanliness standards within the workplace. This classification encompasses a range of cleaning devices tailored for specialized industrial cleaning tasks, distinguishing them from other cleaning applications that may focus on different surfaces or environments.
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

this category encompasses a variety of offerings focused on the care and maintenance of vehicles. It includes products and services designed to clean, polish, and enhance the appearance of vehicles, ensuring they remain in optimal condition. The focus is on vehicle-specific cleaning practices, using appropriate materials and techniques to address the unique challenges presented by different vehicle types. This classification distinguishes itself from other cleaning services, as it specifically targets vehicles rather than general cleaning tasks or specialized cleaning for other surfaces and environments. The aim is to provide comprehensive solutions for maintaining the aesthetic and functional aspects of vehicles, ensuring customer satisfaction and preservation of value.
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

this category encompasses services and products aimed at the eradication and management of unwanted pests and vermin. It includes various methods and tools used to control and eliminate infestations that can adversely affect health, property, and agriculture. The offerings within this classification are distinct from those focused on general cleaning and maintenance tasks, such as maintaining the cleanliness of surfaces, vehicles, textiles, and external facilities. This classification is designed to address specific challenges related to pest management, ensuring effective solutions tailored to the nature of the pests and the environments they inhabit.

a system designed to gather, evaluate, and implement suggestions from employees to enhance workplace efficiency, engagement, and innovation. This framework facilitates communication between employees and management, encouraging the sharing of ideas and feedback. It aims to create a culture of continuous improvement by actively involving employees in decision-making processes related to workplace practices and policies. The system may include features such as anonymous submissions, structured evaluation processes, and recognition for valuable contributions, ultimately fostering a collaborative environment that leverages the collective intelligence of the workforce.

this classification encompasses advantages or incentives that are associated with a system designed to gather and evaluate employee suggestions. It includes various forms of recognition or rewards that motivate employees to actively participate in the suggestion process. The focus is on the positive outcomes or benefits derived from engaging in suggestion management, emphasizing the value added to both employees and the organization through enhanced creativity, innovation, and morale. This category does not overlap with systems for managing suggestions or the specific awards given to recognize individual contributions but instead highlights the broader advantageous implications of the suggestion management framework.

a category representing items or recognitions awarded to individuals or teams in acknowledgment of their contributions or innovative ideas within an employee suggestion management framework. This classification encompasses various forms of accolades, such as trophies, certificates, and other tangible or intangible rewards that motivate and celebrate employee engagement and creativity. The focus is on the distinction of recognizing efforts that enhance organizational performance through employee suggestions, setting it apart from systems that facilitate suggestions or describe other types of benefits related to employee participation.
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

this classification encompasses activities and processes focused on the systematic forecasting and strategic allocation of human resources within an organization. It involves assessing current and future workforce needs, aligning staffing strategies with organizational goals, and implementing plans to ensure that the right personnel are available at the right time. This area is characterized by its emphasis on workforce optimization, succession planning, and talent management, differentiating it from related areas such as vocational education, employee benefits, or recruitment efforts. The focus is on creating a sustainable workforce plan that supports overall business objectives, ensuring that human capital is effectively utilized and developed for long-term success.
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

this category encompasses services aimed at enhancing the skills, knowledge, and competencies of individuals within an organization. It focuses on systematic approaches to foster professional growth and development tailored to the needs of the workforce. The offerings in this category may include training programs, workshops, coaching, and mentoring initiatives designed to improve employee performance and adaptability. Emphasis is placed on assessing the effectiveness of these developmental activities through result checking mechanisms, ensuring that the outcomes align with organizational goals. This category is distinct from other related services that address recruitment, vocational training, employee benefits, and overall personnel management strategies.

this classification refers to services related to the evaluation and validation of outcomes in human resources development initiatives. It encompasses activities designed to assess the effectiveness of training programs, workshops, and other developmental processes aimed at enhancing employee skills and competencies. This includes methodologies and tools used to measure progress, identify areas for improvement, and ensure that objectives are met within the context of workforce development. The focus is on fostering a continuous improvement culture by utilizing feedback and performance metrics to optimize human capital investment.
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

this classification encompasses activities and services related to the process of attracting, selecting, and appointing individuals to fill job vacancies within an organization. It involves strategies and methodologies employed to source candidates, assess their qualifications, and facilitate their integration into the workforce. The focus is on optimizing the recruitment process to meet organizational needs, ensuring a suitable match between candidates and job roles. This classification also includes services that may assist in managing temporary staffing solutions and providing specialized recruitment services. The offerings may vary from internal recruitment initiatives to external partnerships aimed at enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of the personnel acquisition process.

this classification refers to the process of sourcing and selecting candidates for employment within an organization, utilizing internal resources and mechanisms. It encompasses activities aimed at identifying, attracting, and hiring individuals from within the companys existing workforce or through direct outreach to potential candidates who may not be actively seeking new opportunities. This approach emphasizes leveraging internal talent pools and fostering career development opportunities for existing employees, distinguishing it from external recruitment practices. The focus is on ensuring a fit between the organizational culture and the candidates while addressing specific staffing needs in alignment with the companys strategic goals.

a category focused on the provision of skilled labor on a temporary basis, primarily through external recruitment processes. This classification encompasses individuals hired for short-term assignments to fulfill specific operational needs within an organization. It distinguishes itself by emphasizing the acquisition of personnel who are not permanent employees but are engaged for limited durations to support various projects or tasks. This classification does not cover the hiring of permanent staff, the placement of personnel into long-term roles, or services that facilitate the recruitment process itself. Instead, it highlights the flexibility and adaptability of temporary workforce solutions in meeting dynamic business demands.

a category focused on the allocation and assignment of individuals to specific roles or tasks within an organization, emphasizing strategic workforce planning and optimization. This classification encompasses activities related to identifying the appropriate fit for positions, ensuring alignment with organizational needs, and facilitating the effective integration of personnel into teams. It highlights processes that support the efficient use of human resources to achieve organizational objectives, distinct from other recruitment strategies that involve different modes of personnel acquisition or management.

a specialized service focusing on identifying, attracting, and selecting qualified candidates for employment within organizations. This service encompasses various methodologies and techniques to meet the specific hiring needs of businesses, including the use of advanced sourcing strategies, assessments, and interviews. It is distinct from other employment-related services by its emphasis on external recruitment processes, rather than internal hiring or temporary staffing solutions. The aim is to facilitate the acquisition of permanent personnel, ensuring alignment with the organization's culture and strategic objectives. This service is typically provided by external agencies or consultants who specialize in workforce acquisition.

this classification encompasses services related to the temporary provision of management personnel to organizations for specific projects or transitional periods. It involves the strategic selection and engagement of qualified individuals who can step into leadership roles on a short-term basis, ensuring that essential functions within the organization are maintained without interruption. This service is characterized by its focus on high-level positions that require specialized skills and experience, facilitating effective change management and operational continuity during periods of organizational transition. It is distinct from other recruitment services that focus on permanent placements, temporary staffing, or internal hiring processes.
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

this classification encompasses activities and strategies aimed at attracting, engaging, and retaining talent within an organization. It involves the development and implementation of various promotional techniques and initiatives designed to enhance the organization's image as an employer of choice. The focus is on effectively communicating the values, culture, and opportunities available within the organization to potential and current employees. This includes participation in events, collaborations with educational institutions, and the use of marketing tactics to promote the organizations employment opportunities. The classification aims to streamline personnel marketing efforts, ensuring that they align with the overall human resource objectives and contribute positively to the organization's workforce dynamics.

a promotional activity encompasses various strategies and methods employed to enhance the visibility and attractiveness of a product or service to potential customers. This includes the development and execution of campaigns aimed at stimulating interest, encouraging purchases, and fostering brand loyalty. Promotional activities can take many forms, such as advertising, special offers, public relations efforts, and events designed to engage the target audience. The primary objective is to effectively communicate the value proposition and benefits of the offering, ultimately driving sales and customer engagement. This category focuses specifically on initiatives that are distinct from other personnel-marketing approaches, emphasizing creativity and direct interaction with the target market.

this classification encompasses activities and services focused on the distribution and promotion of products through tastings, aimed at engaging potential consumers and enhancing brand awareness. It involves the strategic organization of tasting events to facilitate direct interaction between consumers and products, allowing for firsthand experience and feedback. This approach is typically employed to stimulate interest and encourage purchase decisions, leveraging personal engagement and sensory experiences. The activities may include setting up tasting stations, providing product samples, and employing trained personnel to guide consumers through the tasting process, thereby creating an immersive promotional experience distinct from other marketing methods.

a commercial agent specializing in marketing is an individual or entity engaged in promoting and selling products or services on behalf of a company. This role involves identifying market opportunities, establishing relationships with potential clients, and negotiating sales agreements. Unlike other marketing personnel, the focus here is specifically on representation and advocacy for a brand or product in various markets. The commercial agent plays a crucial role in creating awareness and driving demand through strategic outreach and personalized communication, differentiating their activities from those involved in educational institutions, trade shows, promotional events, or direct product distribution efforts. Their expertise lies in understanding market dynamics and leveraging personal networks to enhance business growth.

this classification encompasses institutions dedicated to higher education that engage in activities related to the recruitment and marketing of personnel. These entities are involved in the development and execution of strategies aimed at attracting students, faculty, and staff, emphasizing their unique offerings and educational programs. The focus is on promoting the institution's values, culture, and academic excellence to prospective candidates. This classification distinguishes itself from other marketing activities by concentrating specifically on educational personnel recruitment rather than broader promotional or distribution methods.

this classification encompasses services and activities related to the organization and management of exhibitions aimed at promoting personnel marketing initiatives. It includes the planning, setup, and execution of events where businesses showcase their offerings to attract potential employees or clients. These activities may involve the design of exhibition spaces, the coordination of logistics, and the engagement of personnel to interact with visitors. This category is distinct from other marketing-related activities that focus on educational institutions, commercial representation, promotional events, or product sampling. The emphasis is placed on creating a platform for businesses to enhance their visibility and connect with target audiences through interactive displays and personal engagement at exhibitions.
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

outplacement refers to the process of assisting employees who are transitioning out of an organization, typically due to downsizing or restructuring. This service aims to support individuals in their career transition by providing resources such as counseling, job search assistance, resume writing, and interview preparation. Outplacement services are designed to help former employees navigate the job market, enhance their employability, and secure new job opportunities, thereby mitigating the impact of job loss on their professional and personal lives. The focus is on delivering tailored support that addresses the unique needs and circumstances of each individual, fostering a smoother transition to new employment.
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

this classification encompasses activities and processes related to the systematic management and oversight of employee information and support functions within an organization. It focuses on the administration of personnel data, ensuring accurate record-keeping, compliance with regulations, and effective management of employee-related documentation. Additionally, it includes support services that assist employees in various aspects of their work life, facilitating a productive and well-organized work environment. The scope is distinct from other areas such as vocational education, social benefits, and recruitment strategies, emphasizing the operational aspects of managing personnel information and providing necessary support to staff members.

a category that encompasses services, tools, and solutions aimed at facilitating the management and support of human resources within an organization. This classification focuses on various aspects of personnel assistance, including recruitment, training, performance management, employee relations, and workforce planning. It is distinct from the management of personnel data, emphasizing instead the operational and strategic support functions that enhance employee engagement and organizational effectiveness. This category is essential for ensuring that personnel resources are effectively utilized and aligned with organizational goals.
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

a category focused on the systematic management and organization of information relating to individuals within an organization. This includes the collection, storage, processing, and analysis of personal data necessary for employment, payroll, benefits administration, and compliance with legal regulations. It encompasses activities such as maintaining employee records, managing credentials, and ensuring the accuracy and confidentiality of personnel information. This classification is distinct from related areas that provide auxiliary support services, emphasizing the core functions of data management in human resources.

Group (3rd level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 2nd level. A xx-xx-90-00-class cannot have any other sub-groups besides the generic xx-xx-90-90-class ((Other, unspecified)) to be generally valid within the parent class on the 2nd level
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

this classification encompasses services related to legal matters, focusing on the provision of expert advice, representation, and assistance concerning legal rights, obligations, and processes. It includes a variety of specialized services that cater to different branches of law, addressing both individual and organizational needs. The scope covers activities that support compliance with legal standards, facilitate dispute resolution, and ensure the protection of legal interests across various contexts. Services in this category are essential for navigating complex legal frameworks and are often delivered by professionals with specific qualifications and expertise in their respective legal fields.
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

this category encompasses services and products specifically designed for the cleaning and maintenance of textiles. It includes various methods and techniques aimed at restoring and preserving the appearance and hygiene of fabric materials. The offerings within this classification may range from professional laundering services to specialized cleaning solutions for upholstered items and medical textiles. Additionally, it covers services related to the care of workwear and floor coverings, ensuring they meet cleanliness and maintenance standards. This classification is distinct from other cleaning services that focus on different surfaces or environments, thereby highlighting its specialized nature within the broader context of cleaning and care.
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
Provision of dry cleaning services through a laundry

a service focused on the cleaning and maintenance of entrance mats and doormats, ensuring their cleanliness, hygiene, and appearance. This service typically involves the removal of dirt, dust, and allergens, as well as the application of appropriate cleaning agents and techniques tailored for textile materials. It may include regular pick-up and delivery, as well as on-site cleaning options, depending on customer needs. This offering is distinct from other cleaning services that cater to various textiles and materials, emphasizing the specific requirements and standards for doormats to maintain their functionality and aesthetic appeal.

a service focused on the specialized cleaning and maintenance of upholstered furniture, which includes items such as sofas, chairs, and cushions. This service employs specific techniques and equipment designed to effectively remove dirt, stains, and allergens from fabric-covered surfaces, ensuring the preservation of appearance and extending the lifespan of the furniture. The process may involve steam cleaning, dry cleaning, or spot treatment, utilizing appropriate cleaning agents that are safe for various types of upholstery materials. This service is distinct from general laundry services or cleaning services for specific items like doormats, medical supplies, or workwear, emphasizing its unique application and expertise in fabric care for furniture.
Cleaning of textiles in nursing and clinical setting based on the ward operation
Cleaning of textiles in nursing and clinical settings based on the operating activity
Cleaning of textiles in the general context of workwear
Cleaning of mops in the context of room cleaning

this classification encompasses services and activities focused on the cleaning and maintenance of external facilities and environments. It includes the systematic removal of dirt, debris, and contaminants from various outdoor areas, ensuring cleanliness and safety for public use. The activities may involve specialized techniques and equipment tailored to specific surfaces and environments, such as streets, roads, squares, and water bodies. Additionally, it covers the upkeep of recreational spaces, such as playgrounds, and may include seasonal services, such as winter maintenance, to manage snow and ice accumulation. The aim is to promote hygiene, aesthetics, and functionality in external spaces, contributing to overall community well-being and environmental health.

this category encompasses products and services specifically designed for the cleaning and maintenance of outdoor surfaces such as streets, roads, and squares. It includes various tools, equipment, and techniques aimed at removing dirt, debris, and other contaminants from these public spaces to ensure safety and cleanliness. The focus is on maintaining the aesthetic and functional aspects of urban environments, distinct from services targeting other specific areas such as water bodies or recreational spaces. Emphasis is placed on methods that enhance the longevity and usability of hard surfaces in outdoor settings, responding to the unique challenges posed by environmental factors and public usage.

a category encompassing various types of clean water specifically allocated for cleaning purposes within external environments. This includes the use of clean water for the maintenance and sanitation of surfaces in outdoor areas, ensuring hygiene and cleanliness in public spaces and facilities. The focus is on the application of water as a primary resource for cleaning activities, distinguishing it from other categories that pertain to the maintenance of roads, streets, squares, or recreational spaces. This classification emphasizes the role of clean water in enhancing the overall cleanliness and aesthetic appeal of external facilities, contributing to public health and environmental standards.

an area designated for recreational activities, specifically designed for children's play, that requires regular maintenance and cleaning to ensure safety and hygiene. This includes the removal of debris, litter, and contaminants, as well as the upkeep of surfaces and equipment to promote a clean and safe environment for users. This classification focuses on the unique aspects and requirements of maintaining playground areas, distinguishing it from other external cleaning services associated with public spaces such as streets, roads, and bodies of water, as well as seasonal maintenance tasks.
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

All services required for safe access to buildings/properties, taking into account legal requirements such as: - Snow clearing and gritting service - Provision of snow clearing equipment - Creation of a priority plan according to room zones - Detailed logging of operations (DIN 32736:2000.08)

this category encompasses services focused on the care and maintenance of plants and gardening environments. It includes activities related to the cultivation, management, and enhancement of plant life, ensuring optimal growth and aesthetic appeal. The offerings may cover a range of tasks such as soil preparation, planting, pruning, watering, fertilizing, and pest management specifically tailored to horticultural needs. This classification is distinct from other cleaning and maintenance services, as it emphasizes the nurturing of living plants and the overall upkeep of green spaces, whether residential or commercial.
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
