definition.text: this classification encompasses methods and processes utilized in the analysis of chemical properties and physical characteristics within research and development contexts. It includes techniques that are essential for understanding the behavior and interactions of substances at a molecular or atomic level. The focus is on systematic evaluation and interpretation of data to support innovation and quality assurance in various applications. This category is distinct from other analytical methods, emphasizing a comprehensive approach to assessing the physical and chemical attributes of materials in a research setting. The aim is to facilitate advancements in scientific knowledge and technological development through rigorous testing and analysis.

this category encompasses techniques and methodologies utilized to analyze the interaction of matter with electromagnetic radiation, primarily for the purpose of gaining insights into the composition, structure, and properties of substances. It is focused on research and developmental activities aimed at advancing scientific knowledge and innovation. The processes involved may include various forms of spectroscopy such as UV-Vis, infrared, nuclear magnetic resonance, and mass spectrometry, among others. This classification is distinct from other analytical methods that focus on different aspects of material analysis and testing, ensuring a comprehensive approach to research in the field.

keywords.label: Mass spectrometry (MS) (R and D)
Nuclear resonance spectroscopy (NMR) (R and D)
Infrared spectroscopy (IR), Raman spectroscopy (R and D)
X-ray diffractometry (R and D)

definition.text: this classification pertains to a field of study focused on the examination and evaluation of surfaces through various analytical techniques. It encompasses methodologies aimed at understanding surface properties, interactions, and behaviors under different conditions. The scope includes both qualitative and quantitative assessments that may involve experimental designs, data collection, and interpretation relevant to surface characteristics. This area is essential for advancing knowledge in material science, engineering, and product development, contributing to innovations and improvements in various applications. It plays a critical role in enhancing performance, durability, and functionality of materials and products across multiple industries.

keywords.label: Molecule simulation and spectrum calculation (R and D)
Scanning force mikroscopy (R and D)

Grid electron microscopy (R and D)

definition.text: a systematic approach involving intricate methodologies and procedures designed to evaluate, analyze, and validate the performance, characteristics, and properties of materials or products within the context of research and development. This encompasses a variety of advanced techniques that integrate multiple testing paradigms to uncover detailed insights and support innovation. The focus is on achieving comprehensive understanding and optimization of materials or products, ensuring they meet specific standards and requirements for functionality, reliability, and safety. Such methods are essential for advancing knowledge in scientific and engineering fields, facilitating the development of cutting-edge solutions and technologies.

preferred_name.label: Mechanical technological testing of material (research and development)

definition.text: this category encompasses activities related to the mechanical evaluation and analysis of materials within the context of research and development. It involves the application of various testing methodologies to assess the mechanical properties and performance characteristics of materials. These assessments may include tests for strength, durability, flexibility, and other fundamental mechanical traits. The focus is on advancing knowledge and understanding of material behavior under different conditions, contributing to innovation and development in various fields. This classification supports efforts to ensure material reliability and effectiveness in practical applications, distinguishing it from other analytical methods and testing techniques that examine different material properties or employ alternative approaches.

preferred_name.label: Physical testing of material (research and development)

definition.text: this category encompasses activities focused on the physical evaluation of materials within a research and development context. It involves the assessment of physical properties and behaviors of materials under various conditions to understand their performance, durability, and suitability for specific applications. Techniques employed may include stress testing, thermal analysis, and other methodologies aimed at quantifying attributes such as strength, elasticity, and thermal stability. The results from these evaluations guide the development of new materials or the enhancement of existing ones, ensuring they meet required standards for functionality and safety in their intended use.

preferred_name.label: Stability examination for material (research and development)

definition.text: this classification encompasses activities focused on the assessment of the stability of materials through various methodologies. It involves systematic investigations aimed at understanding how materials behave over time under different conditions, ensuring their reliability and performance in intended applications. This includes evaluating factors such as degradation, durability, and resistance to environmental influences. The activities may involve both experimental and theoretical approaches to determine the longevity and integrity of materials, contributing to the development of safer and more effective products. The insights gained from these assessments are crucial for informing design decisions and regulatory compliance within research and development contexts.

this classification pertains to the discipline focused on the study and analysis of specimens at the microscopic level, employing advanced techniques to investigate material properties and behaviors. It encompasses methodologies that enhance understanding of microstructures, enabling research and development efforts in various scientific fields. The activities within this classification involve precise measurements and observations that contribute to the innovation and improvement of products or processes, supporting the advancement of knowledge in both theoretical and practical applications. This domain is distinguished by its emphasis on the detailed examination of materials and phenomena that occur at micro scales, facilitating groundbreaking discoveries and technological advancements.

this category encompasses methodologies and practices focused on the examination and evaluation of structural properties and behaviors through innovative research and development techniques. It involves systematic investigation and analysis aimed at understanding the integrity and performance of materials and structures under various conditions. This includes assessing the influence of environmental factors, load conditions, and material compositions on structural stability and functionality. The outcomes of these analyses contribute to advancements in design, safety, and application of materials in various industries, ensuring compliance with relevant standards and enhancing product reliability.

a systematic evaluation process designed to assess the performance, reliability, and functionality of products or systems within the context of innovation and development. This examination is pivotal in the refinement of prototypes and concepts, ensuring they meet predefined criteria and standards before proceeding to further stages of development or production. The focus is on identifying potential issues, verifying compliance with specifications, and optimizing designs to enhance overall effectiveness. this classification encompasses activities related to the systematic investigation and evaluation of clinical methodologies and protocols to assess the safety, efficacy, and overall performance of medical products or services. It includes the planning, execution, and analysis of clinical trials, as well as the gathering and interpretation of data to support regulatory submissions and scientific research. The focus is on understanding the impact of the subject under study in a controlled environment, while adhering to ethical standards and regulatory guidelines. This classification distinguishes itself from other research methodologies by specifically targeting the clinical context and ensuring that findings contribute to advancements in healthcare and patient outcomes.

preferred_name.label: Marketing and management, national economy (training, further training)

definition.text: this classification encompasses educational programs and courses designed to enhance knowledge and skills related to marketing and management within the context of national economic frameworks. The focus is on various aspects of business and economic principles, including strategies for effective marketing, management practices, and the understanding of economic systems at both micro and macro levels. It includes specialized training in areas such as personnel management, financial accounting, purchasing, and public economy. The offerings aim to equip individuals with the competencies needed to navigate and contribute to the economic landscape, emphasizing administrative and production economics as key areas of study. This classification serves those seeking to develop expertise in managing resources, understanding market dynamics, and applying economic theories to real-world scenarios.

preferred_name.label: General marketing and management (training, further training)

definition.text: this category encompasses various activities and resources designed to enhance knowledge and skills related to marketing and management principles. It includes educational programs, workshops, and training sessions aimed at developing competencies in strategic planning, market analysis, consumer behavior, and organizational leadership within the context of national economic frameworks. The focus is on providing individuals with the necessary tools and insights to effectively navigate and influence market dynamics and management practices. This classification is distinct from related areas that emphasize personnel management, financial accounting, procurement, and broader economic theories, ensuring a specialized approach to advancing expertise in marketing and management disciplines.

preferred_name.label: Personnel management, social welfare matters (training, further training)

definition.text: this category encompasses activities and processes aimed at the development and management of personnel within organizations, focusing on aspects related to social welfare, training, and further education. It involves strategies and practices that enhance employee skills, promote well-being, and foster professional growth. The emphasis is on creating an environment conducive to continuous learning and improvement in workforce capabilities, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and societal needs. This classification distinguishes itself by addressing specific methodologies and frameworks pertinent to human resources and social responsibility, setting it apart from broader economic, financial, and general management training areas.

the classification encompasses educational offerings focused on financial and accounting principles, including both introductory and advanced training programs. It aims to equip individuals with the skills necessary for effective financial management, accounting practices, and economic analysis. This category also addresses the development of competencies relevant to personal and organizational finance, emphasizing the application of theoretical knowledge in practical scenarios. The training may cover various facets such as financial reporting, budgeting, taxation, and financial analysis, catering to professionals seeking to enhance their expertise in finance and accounting within the context of broader economic and managerial frameworks.

this category encompasses educational programs and training activities focused on the principles, strategies, and techniques related to purchasing and stock management. It aims to equip participants with the knowledge and skills necessary to effectively manage inventory, optimize purchasing processes, and understand supply chain dynamics. The training may cover various aspects such as negotiation techniques, supplier relationship management, inventory control methods, and the use of technology in procurement. It is designed for individuals seeking to enhance their expertise in the management of goods and services within an organizational context, ensuring efficient operations and cost-effectiveness.

this category encompasses educational programs and courses focused on the principles and practices of marketing within the context of distributive trade. It includes training aimed at enhancing skills in promoting products and services, understanding market dynamics, and developing strategies for effective distribution. The emphasis is on equipping individuals with the knowledge necessary to navigate the complexities of marketing within trade environments, fostering both theoretical understanding and practical application. This classification serves professionals seeking to advance their expertise in marketing methodologies, consumer behavior analysis, and sales strategies relevant to the distribution sector. It is distinct from other educational offerings related to broader management, economic principles, or specialized fields within the business landscape.

this classification encompasses educational resources and training programs focused on the principles and practices of management and organizational development. It includes methods for enhancing organizational efficiency, leadership skills, strategic planning, and team dynamics. The offerings may cover various aspects such as change management, project management, and effective communication within organizations. This classification is distinct in its emphasis on the theoretical and practical approaches to managing teams and resources in various contexts, enabling individuals and organizations to enhance their performance and adapt to evolving challenges in the business environment.

this classification encompasses educational programs and resources focused on the principles and practices related to production economics. It includes training and further education aimed at enhancing understanding of economic factors influencing production processes, efficiency, and resource allocation within various industries. The content may cover topics such as cost analysis, production optimization, and the impact of economic theories on operational decision-making. This classification is distinct from other areas of marketing and management, as well as various branches of national economy training, emphasizing specific methodologies and strategies pertinent to production environments within the economic framework.

this classification encompasses educational programs and resources focused on the principles and practices of administrative economics. It includes training offerings aimed at enhancing knowledge and skills related to the efficient management and allocation of resources within organizations, as well as understanding the economic factors that influence administrative decision-making. The emphasis is on equipping individuals with the tools necessary to analyze and address economic challenges within an administrative context, fostering professional growth in areas related to organizational efficiency, policy formulation, and strategic planning. This classification serves as a distinct category within the broader field of economic training and professional development.

this classification encompasses educational offerings and resources focused on the principles and practices of the national economy, aimed at enhancing knowledge and skills in areas relevant to economic systems and policies at the national level. It includes training programs, workshops, and courses that address various aspects of national economic frameworks, emphasizing the importance of understanding economic indicators, government policies, and their implications for society. The content is designed for individuals seeking to deepen their expertise in economic theory, national fiscal management, and the impact of economic decisions on broader societal outcomes. This classification distinguishes itself from other educational areas by concentrating specifically on the national economic context rather than broader marketing, management, or specialized economic disciplines.

this classification encompasses educational offerings focused on the principles and applications of microeconomics, aiming to enhance understanding of individual economic agents' behavior, market dynamics, and decision-making processes. It includes various training and further training programs designed to equip participants with the analytical tools and theoretical frameworks necessary for analyzing economic situations at a micro level. The content may cover topics such as consumer behavior, production theory, market structures, and the impact of government policies on individual markets. This classification is distinct from other areas that focus on broader economic frameworks or specialized fields within management and economics, ensuring a targeted approach to learning about microeconomic concepts and their practical applications.

this category encompasses educational programs and resources focused on the study of the economy as a whole, emphasizing the behavior and interactions of aggregate economic variables. It includes training that provides understanding of essential concepts, theories, and methodologies relevant to macroeconomic analysis. Participants will explore topics such as economic growth, inflation, unemployment, and fiscal and monetary policy. The aim is to equip individuals with the knowledge and skills necessary for informed decision-making and effective management within various economic contexts. This classification serves those seeking to enhance their expertise in macroeconomic principles and their applications in real-world scenarios.

a category encompassing the leasing services related to temporary structures and shelters designed for various events or purposes. This includes the rental of items such as portable enclosures, modular buildings, and temporary outdoor coverings. The focus is on providing clients with flexible, short-term solutions for gatherings, exhibitions, and other activities that require sheltered spaces. Services may also involve delivery, setup, and dismantling of these structures, ensuring a comprehensive rental experience tailored to the specific needs of the client.

a category that encompasses movable assets designed for the purpose of facilitating the transportation of goods or individuals on a temporary basis, typically provided through a rental agreement. These assets are utilized in various logistics operations and can include a range of vehicles or devices that enhance the efficiency of transport services. The focus is on rental options that cater specifically to transportation needs, distinguishing them from other forms of rental services related to infrastructure, equipment, real estate, or furnishings. this classification encompasses activities related to the performance of laboratory analyses and testing specifically conducted in a medical context. It includes the examination and evaluation of various biological and chemical samples to support clinical diagnostics, treatment monitoring, and medical research. The activities are characterized by their adherence to established protocols and standards, ensuring accuracy and reliability in results. The focus is on a wide range of laboratory procedures that assess the composition, function, and presence of substances in biological specimens, contributing to patient care and medical decision-making. This classification is distinct from other laboratory-related services that pertain to different aspects of analysis, inspection, or research activities.

this classification encompasses laboratory services specifically designed for the execution and management of clinical trials. It involves a range of testing and analytical procedures essential for evaluating the safety, efficacy, and quality of medical products, including pharmaceuticals and medical devices, within a controlled environment. The services provided may include sample collection, processing, analysis, and reporting of results, all conducted under stringent regulatory guidelines to ensure compliance with relevant standards and protocols. This classification is distinct from other laboratory activities that focus on specific substances or conditions, as it is primarily concerned with the comprehensive assessment of products in a clinical research context.
Provision of medical laboratory services, especially in the areas of dentistry and orthodontics

this category encompasses a range of inorganic substances utilized in laboratory settings, primarily for analytical and diagnostic purposes. These materials are essential in various scientific procedures, contributing to the understanding and evaluation of biological samples. The focus is on chemical compounds that do not contain carbon-hydrogen bonds, playing a critical role in medical testing and research. This classification aids in the systematic organization of laboratory resources, ensuring that professionals can efficiently identify and access the necessary materials for their specific analytical tasks. The substances included are vital for accurate laboratory results and the advancement of medical science.

this classification encompasses substances and analytical procedures used in the assessment of blood gas levels in a laboratory setting. It includes various tests aimed at measuring parameters such as oxygen, carbon dioxide, and pH levels in the blood. These analyses are crucial for evaluating respiratory function, metabolic disturbances, and overall physiological status. The focus is on laboratory practices that involve precise instrumentation and methodologies to ensure accurate and reliable results, contributing to clinical decision-making and patient care in medical environments. This classification distinctly separates it from other laboratory activities that focus on different biochemical or physiological components.

this classification encompasses substances that facilitate biochemical reactions in laboratory settings, specifically those utilized in various analytical and diagnostic processes. These agents are critical in enhancing the efficiency and accuracy of laboratory tests, particularly in medical and clinical environments. They may be derived from natural or synthetic sources and are employed in a range of applications, including but not limited to diagnostics, research, and therapeutic monitoring. The classification distinguishes these substances based on their functional roles and the specific laboratory activities they support, setting them apart from other categories of laboratory reagents and materials.

this classification encompasses activities and procedures related to the analysis and examination of various biological samples to assess health conditions and diagnose diseases. It includes the utilization of specific techniques and methodologies that are integral to the practice of clinical chemistry within a laboratory setting. This area focuses on the measurement and interpretation of chemical constituents in body fluids, contributing to the understanding of metabolic processes and aiding in the monitoring of therapeutic interventions. The classification distinguishes itself from similar laboratory activities by emphasizing the unique aspects of chemical analysis and its application in clinical diagnostics.

a process used in laboratory settings to separate macromolecules, such as nucleic acids and proteins, based on their size and charge. This technique involves the movement of charged particles through a gel or liquid medium under the influence of an electric field. Applications of this method are widespread in various fields, including molecular biology, biochemistry, and genetics, facilitating the analysis and purification of biomolecules. It is particularly valuable for research, diagnostics, and quality control in medical laboratories, enabling the identification and characterization of biological samples.

a category dedicated to the specialized analysis and testing of biological samples specifically related to hormonal and endocrine functions within the body. This classification encompasses a range of laboratory activities that focus on the assessment of endocrine disorders, hormone levels, and related biochemical markers. It includes methodologies and techniques employed in the diagnosis, monitoring, and research of conditions affecting the endocrine system, thereby facilitating targeted healthcare solutions. The activities within this category are essential for understanding various health issues influenced by hormonal imbalances and contribute significantly to patient care and treatment strategies in the medical field.

a category focused on the analysis and examination of cerebrospinal fluid, which is critical for diagnosing various neurological conditions and diseases. This includes the collection, processing, and interpretation of fluid samples from the central nervous system. The activities within this classification encompass a range of laboratory techniques and methods utilized to assess the physical, chemical, and cellular characteristics of cerebrospinal fluid. This category plays a vital role in the medical diagnostics landscape, aiding healthcare professionals in understanding and managing conditions affecting the brain and spinal cord. The processes involved are integral to ensuring accurate and reliable results for patient care and treatment decisions.

a diagnostic procedure involving the analysis of biological samples to detect the presence of specific substances that indicate the presence or progression of tumors. This process is essential in oncology for monitoring disease status, evaluating treatment responses, and aiding in the diagnosis of various cancers. The focus is on identifying markers that can provide valuable insights into tumor characteristics, allowing healthcare professionals to make informed decisions regarding patient management and therapeutic strategies. This activity is conducted in specialized laboratory settings equipped with advanced analytical techniques and tools to ensure accuracy and reliability of results.

this category encompasses substances utilized for therapeutic purposes within laboratory settings, primarily aimed at the diagnosis, treatment, or prevention of diseases. These products may be derived from natural or synthetic sources and are specifically formulated to influence biological processes or offer therapeutic benefits. The classification distinguishes these items based on their application in medical laboratory activities, ensuring clarity in identifying and managing products related to therapeutic interventions. This includes a variety of preparations that may be assessed through laboratory tests to monitor their efficacy and safety in clinical use, as well as their impact on patient health outcomes.

this classification encompasses laboratory activities focused on the analysis and testing of blood components and related parameters for diagnostic and monitoring purposes. It involves various methodologies and technologies to evaluate hematological characteristics, such as red and white blood cell counts, hemoglobin levels, platelet counts, and other blood-related metrics. The objective is to assist healthcare professionals in diagnosing conditions related to blood disorders, infections, and other hematological abnormalities. This category is distinct from other laboratory activities that concentrate on different substances or analytical techniques, ensuring a specialized approach to hematology within the broader medical laboratory context.

this category encompasses laboratory activities focused on the study and analysis of hemostasis, which involves the processes that prevent and control bleeding. It includes a range of diagnostic tests and procedures that assess the coagulation system, evaluate platelet function, and measure various components of blood that play a role in hemostatic balance. The activities within this classification are essential for diagnosing and managing disorders related to blood clotting, providing critical information for treatment decisions in clinical settings.

this category encompasses services focused on the creation and execution of marketing strategies and promotional materials aimed at enhancing brand visibility and engagement. It involves the conceptualization and production of various advertising formats, including print, digital, and multimedia campaigns. Services offered may include the design and implementation of promotional gifts, comprehensive advertising strategies, and direct marketing initiatives. Additionally, it covers the development of creative concepts for visual media, including television and radio productions, as well as the preparation of advertising texts and photographic content. This classification is distinct from other marketing services by emphasizing creativity and innovation in advertising approaches, ensuring a tailored response to market demands and client objectives.

this category encompasses the foundational ideas and strategies that facilitate the competitive presentation of products or services through advertising. It focuses on the conceptualization and development of advertising materials that effectively communicate value propositions and engage target audiences. This includes the crafting of messages, visual elements, and overall presentation techniques that enhance brand visibility and appeal in a competitive marketplace. The emphasis is on innovative approaches that differentiate offerings and promote them in a compelling manner, ensuring alignment with market trends and consumer preferences. The aim is to create impactful advertising solutions that resonate with potential customers and drive engagement.

preferred_name.label: Internet/intranet (concept, web site design, portal solution)

definition.text: this classification pertains to services focused on the development and design of digital platforms and solutions intended for communication or interaction over the internet or intranet. The services may include scriptwriting, storyboarding, video editing, and graphic design, all tailored to enhance brand visibility and engagement. This classification is distinct from other creative services that focus on physical promotional items, direct marketing strategies, or digital marketing solutions, highlighting its unique role in the advertising landscape.

this classification encompasses services related to the conceptualization and production of audio-visual content destined for television and radio platforms, including the crafting of creative concepts, shooting, and the execution of broadcasts or commercials. This category is distinct from other marketing and advertising services that focus on different mediums or approaches, such as promotional items, direct marketing, or digital solutions, highlighting its unique emphasis on broadcast media and creative storytelling within the advertising landscape.

this category encompasses the processes and activities involved in the conceptualization and preparation of visual and written content specifically aimed at promoting products or services through advertising. The emphasis is on innovative approaches and strategic thinking to enhance brand visibility and impact, ensuring that the final output aligns with the overarching marketing objectives. a business entity that specializes in promoting products or services directly to consumers through various marketing strategies and channels. this category encompasses educational programs and training initiatives focused on the principles, techniques, and applications within the field of process engineering and materials science. It aims to enhance the knowledge and skills of individuals in the areas of material properties, processing methods, and technology related to various materials, including metals, non-metals, and polymers. The training may cover specialized topics such as chemical process engineering, water purification, and metallurgy, along with practical applications in mixing, separation, and surface treatments. By fostering expertise in these areas, the category supports professional development for individuals seeking to advance their capabilities in process engineering and material handling, equipping them to address industry challenges and innovate in their respective fields.

this classification encompasses educational and training activities focused on the principles and practices of process engineering within various industrial contexts. It covers a broad range of methodologies and techniques aimed at enhancing the understanding and application of process engineering concepts. The offerings may include foundational training, advanced courses, and specialized workshops designed to equip individuals with the knowledge and skills necessary to effectively engage in process engineering tasks. The emphasis is on fostering expertise that can be applied across diverse scenarios in the field, contributing to the development of innovative solutions and improvements in process efficiency and effectiveness. This classification serves as a foundation for professionals seeking to advance their understanding and capabilities in process engineering.

preferred_name.label: Mixing technology, separation technology (training, further training)

definition.text: this classification encompasses technologies and methodologies focused on the mixing and separation of materials, particularly within training and further development contexts. It includes processes and practices that enhance knowledge and skills related to the manipulation and refinement of substances, ensuring optimal outcomes in various applications. The emphasis is on both theoretical understanding and practical implementation, preparing individuals for advanced roles in related fields. This classification distinctly addresses specific techniques and best practices that differentiate it from general concepts of process engineering, as well as specialized areas such as chemical processes and material testing. It serves to support the professional development of individuals engaged in the field, fostering expertise in modern approaches to material interaction and separation.

this classification encompasses educational programs and training initiatives focused on chemical process engineering. It includes specialized instruction and skill development related to the application of chemical principles in industrial processes, emphasizing areas such as reaction engineering, process design, and optimization. The offerings are structured to enhance knowledge and practical skills necessary for professionals in the chemical engineering field, enabling them to address challenges in various sectors, including pharmaceuticals, petrochemicals, and environmental engineering. This category is distinct from other training offerings that focus on general process engineering or specific technologies related to materials manipulation, separation methods, and water treatment processes.

this classification encompasses methodologies and systems designed for the purification of water, focusing on educational aspects such as training and further training. It includes a range of techniques and technologies aimed at improving water quality for various applications, ensuring compliance with health and environmental standards. The classification addresses both theoretical knowledge and practical skills, providing a comprehensive framework for individuals seeking to enhance their expertise in water purification processes. It emphasizes the importance of continuous professional development in this critical field, catering to diverse sectors that require specialized knowledge in water treatment and management.

training and further education focused on methods and technologies related to the management, treatment, and disposal of wastewater and sewage. This includes comprehensive instruction on processes aimed at preventing pollution, conserving resources, and ensuring public health and environmental safety. The education may encompass theoretical knowledge as well as practical skills necessary for the operation and maintenance of sewage treatment facilities, equipment, and systems. Participants are equipped to understand the intricacies of sewage technology, including biological, chemical, and physical processes, along with the regulatory frameworks governing wastewater management. This training is essential for professionals involved in environmental science, civil engineering, and public health sectors.

this classification encompasses educational programs and training modules specifically focused on the principles, techniques, and applications within metallurgy. It includes both foundational and advanced learning opportunities aimed at enhancing skills related to the processing, treatment, and analysis of metallic materials. The focus may cover various aspects such as metal fabrication, alloy development, heat treatment processes, and metallurgy-related quality control. Training in this area is designed to equip individuals with the knowledge required to understand the characteristics of metals, the implications of their properties in practical applications, and the methodologies employed in their manipulation and testing. This classification is distinct from other educational areas within process engineering and materials, which may address different materials or technological processes.

this classification encompasses a range of training and further education materials specifically focused on metallic substances and their properties. It includes instructional content, resources, and tools aimed at enhancing knowledge and skills related to the characteristics, processing, and applications of metals in various contexts. The emphasis is on understanding the behavior of metallic materials in engineering processes, their interactions with other materials, and their roles in different industrial applications. This category is distinct from related areas of study that cover non-metallic materials, general process engineering, and specific technologies such as mixing, separation, and chemical processes, as well as advanced topics in corrosion and surface treatments.

this classification encompasses educational resources and training programs focused on non-metallic materials, which are essential in various industrial applications and processes. It includes courses, workshops, and instructional materials designed to enhance the understanding and skills related to the properties, applications, and processing of non-metallic substances. This category aims to equip individuals with the knowledge necessary to effectively work with and innovate in the realm of non-metallic materials, distinguishing it from other specialized training areas related to various engineering processes and technologies. The emphasis is on fostering expertise in the handling, manipulation, and application of non-metallic materials in a professional context, promoting best practices and advancements in the field.

this classification encompasses educational resources and training programs specifically focused on plastics and polymers. this classification refers to the specialized training and further education focused on evaluating the properties and performance of various materials through systematic testing methods. this category encompasses educational programs and resources focused on the study and application of legal principles and systems. It includes various forms of training designed to enhance knowledge and skills in the field of law, catering to individuals seeking to deepen their understanding of legal frameworks and practices. The offerings may cover a wide range of topics, including but not limited to constitutional law, private law, corporate law, and criminal law. The objective is to equip learners with the necessary competencies to navigate legal challenges and engage effectively within the legal profession or related fields. This classification aims to provide structured pathways for professional development and specialization within jurisprudence.

this classification encompasses educational programs and resources focused on the principles, theories, and applications of constitutional law. It includes training and further training opportunities aimed at enhancing knowledge and skills related to the legal framework that governs the structure and function of government, the rights of individuals, and the relationship between different entities within a legal context. This area of study is distinct from other legal disciplines that address private, industrial, corporate, tax, patent, administrative, criminal, commercial, international, family, and European law. The offerings may include courses, workshops, seminars, and materials designed for legal professionals, students, and individuals seeking to deepen their understanding of constitutional principles and their practical implications.

this classification encompasses educational and training opportunities focused on private law, which deals with legal relationships and disputes between private individuals or entities. It includes programs designed to enhance knowledge and skills in areas such as contract law, tort law, property law, and family law. The training may cover theoretical foundations, practical applications, and case studies to provide a comprehensive understanding of private legal principles. This classification is distinct from other legal training areas that focus on public law or specialized sectors such as taxation, corporate regulation, or international law. The aim is to equip learners with the necessary competencies to navigate and apply private law effectively in various contexts.

preferred_name.label: Industrial law, social right (training, further training)

definition.text: this classification encompasses educational programs and resources focused on the principles and applications of industrial law and social rights. It is designed for individuals seeking to enhance their knowledge and skills in legal frameworks related to labor relations, workplace regulations, and social justice within industrial contexts. The content typically includes topics such as employment law, collective bargaining, labor rights, and the intersection of legal standards with social policies. This classification serves as a distinct category within the broader legal education framework, differentiating it from other areas of law that address constitutional, corporate, tax, patent, administrative, criminal, commercial, international, family, and European legal matters, all within a training and further training context.

this classification encompasses educational programs and resources focused on corporate law, emphasizing the principles, regulations, and practices governing business transactions and organizational operations. It includes various forms of training and further education designed to enhance knowledge of legal frameworks relevant to corporations, including compliance, governance, and risk management. This category aims to equip individuals with the necessary skills to navigate the complexities of corporate legal environments, ensuring adherence to applicable laws and ethical standards. It differentiates itself from other legal training areas by its specific focus on corporate structures, responsibilities, and liabilities, addressing the unique challenges faced by businesses in today's regulatory landscape.

this classification encompasses educational programs and resources focused on tax law, including both foundational training and specialized further education. It covers a range of topics related to taxation, such as tax regulations, compliance, and strategies for effective tax planning. The instruction may be offered through various modalities, including workshops, seminars, online courses, and formal classes, catering to individuals seeking to enhance their understanding of taxation principles and practices. This classification is distinct from other areas of legal education, emphasizing the unique aspects of tax legislation and its application in various contexts. It is designed for learners aiming to develop expertise in tax matters, whether for personal knowledge, professional development, or compliance purposes.

this classification encompasses educational programs and resources focused on the legal frameworks governing patents and copyrights. It includes training and further training opportunities designed to enhance knowledge and skills related to intellectual property rights, legal protection of creative works, and the nuances of copyright and patent law. The aim is to equip individuals with the necessary expertise to navigate the complexities of intellectual property legislation, enforce rights, and understand the implications of legal decisions in this field. This classification is distinct from other areas of law, emphasizing specialized knowledge in intellectual property as it pertains to both training and further professional development.

this classification encompasses educational programs and courses focused on the principles, theories, and applications of administrative law. It addresses the legal frameworks governing the activities of public authorities and their interactions with individuals and organizations. The training offered under this classification aims to enhance understanding of regulatory compliance, administrative procedures, and the legal rights and obligations of parties involved in administrative processes. It serves individuals seeking to deepen their expertise in the governance of public administration, ensuring they are well-equipped to navigate the complexities of regulatory environments. This category is distinct from other legal training areas, emphasizing the unique aspects of administrative law and its practical implications in various sectors.

this classification pertains to educational programs and courses focused on the principles, practices, and procedures of criminal law. It encompasses training aimed at enhancing knowledge and skills related to criminal justice, including the study of offenses, legal defenses, and the roles of various parties within the criminal justice system. The offerings may include foundational training as well as advanced studies designed for professionals seeking to deepen their expertise in criminal law. This classification is distinct from other legal training areas by its specific emphasis on criminal offenses, legal repercussions, and the workings of law enforcement and the judiciary in the context of crime.

this classification encompasses educational offerings focused on the principles and practices associated with commercial law. this classification encompasses educational and training programs focused on the principles and practices of international private law. The offerings in this category aim to enhance the knowledge and skills of legal professionals in navigating the complexities of international legal relationships and transactions. This area of study is distinct from other legal fields, emphasizing the interplay between varying national laws and international regulations in the context of private law.

a category dedicated to educational programs and professional development focused on the principles, practices, and regulations governing international relations and cross-border legal issues. The aim is to equip participants with the knowledge and skills necessary to navigate the complexities of international legal frameworks, enhancing their ability to operate effectively in a global context. This classification serves those seeking to deepen their understanding of laws that transcend national boundaries, facilitating both personal and professional growth in the field of international law.

this classification encompasses educational offerings related to family law, focusing on both initial and advanced training programs. a category focused on the educational and training aspects related to the body of laws that govern the European Union and its member states. this classification encompasses services focused on the assessment and evaluation of materials and components to ensure their quality, safety, and compliance with specified standards. It involves a range of examination techniques that may include both destructive and non-destructive methods. The activities are designed to determine the physical, chemical, and mechanical properties of materials, as well as their performance under various conditions. The objective is to identify potential defects, measure reliability, and verify the integrity of materials and components prior to their use in production or final application. This classification supports industries in maintaining high-quality standards and ensuring the reliability of materials throughout their lifecycle.

this classification encompasses methods and techniques employed to assess the integrity and properties of materials and components without causing any damage or alteration to the specimen being examined. It includes a variety of procedures aimed at detecting defects, evaluating structural integrity, and ensuring compliance with specified standards, all while preserving the functionality and usability of the items tested. The focus is on non-invasive measurement techniques that provide insights into material characteristics, such as composition, structure, and potential flaws, facilitating quality assurance and control in manufacturing and engineering processes.

this classification encompasses processes and methodologies used to assess the mechanical properties and performance characteristics of materials and components without causing any damage. It involves systematic evaluations to determine factors such as strength, durability, and resistance to various forces or loads. The focus is on ensuring that materials and components meet specified mechanical standards and requirements for their intended applications. This category includes various testing techniques aimed at identifying potential flaws or weaknesses in the structure and composition of the items, thereby guaranteeing their reliability and safety in practical use.

this classification pertains to the systematic evaluation of materials and components through processes that involve their destruction or alteration. It encompasses methodologies aimed at assessing the integrity, properties, and performance characteristics of materials by intentionally causing failure or damage. The techniques employed may include mechanical testing, thermal analysis, or chemical disintegration, which provide critical insights into the material's structure and behavior under various conditions. This examination is essential for quality assurance, research and development, and compliance with safety standards, ensuring that materials and components meet the necessary performance criteria for their intended applications.

the examination focused on the stability of materials and components involves assessing their ability to maintain performance and integrity under various conditions over time. This process includes evaluating factors such as structural integrity, resistance to environmental influences, and durability under stress or load. The purpose is to identify potential failures or degradation that may occur during use, ensuring that materials and components meet safety and reliability standards. This type of examination is critical in industries where long-term performance is essential, as it helps in predicting the lifespan and operational reliability of products, thereby supporting quality assurance and compliance with regulatory requirements.

preferred_name.label: Microscopy, micro analytics (material and component examination)

definition.text: this classification encompasses techniques and methodologies utilized for the examination and analysis of materials and components at a microscopic level. It involves the use of advanced optical or electron microscopy tools to investigate the structure, composition, and properties of materials. This detailed examination aids in identifying micro-level features, defects, and characteristics that affect the overall functionality and quality of the materials or components. The processes included within this classification focus on non-invasive methods to ensure the integrity of the samples while providing valuable insights into their physical and chemical properties, thereby supporting quality assurance, research, and development across various industries.

keywords.label: Micro-area analysis material and construction component tests)

definition.text: this classification encompasses methods and techniques focused on the analysis of surfaces of materials and components to assess their properties, characteristics, and quality. It involves evaluating surface features, such as texture, finish, coatings, and potential defects, using various analytical approaches. The objective is to ensure that surfaces meet specified requirements for functionality, durability, and performance in their intended applications. Surface analytics plays a critical role in quality control and assurance processes, contributing to the overall integrity and reliability of products by identifying surface-related issues that may affect performance or longevity.

this classification pertains to the systematic analysis of materials and components through metallographic techniques, which involve the study of the microstructure and properties of metals and alloys. It encompasses methods such as optical microscopy, scanning electron microscopy, and other analytical techniques that reveal the internal structure and characteristics of the material. The focus is on understanding the relationship between the microstructure and the material's performance, including aspects such as grain size, phase distribution, and the presence of defects. This type of investigation is essential for quality assurance, failure analysis, and the development of new materials, ensuring that they meet required standards and specifications for various applications.

preferred_name.label: Examination of workability and processing influence (material and component)

definition.text: this classification pertains to the assessment of the workability and processing characteristics of materials and components. It involves evaluating how these entities respond to various processing conditions and operational demands, focusing on both their physical and structural properties. The examination aims to identify the influences of different factors, such as temperature, pressure, and environmental conditions, on the performance and effectiveness of the material or component during its intended use. This process is crucial for ensuring that the selected materials and components meet the necessary standards for functionality, durability, and reliability in their applications.

preferred_name.label: Examination of behavior in case of fire (material and component)

definition.text: this classification encompasses methods and procedures aimed at assessing the behavior of materials and components when exposed to fire conditions. The focus is on understanding how various substances react under thermal stress, which may include changes in physical properties, structural integrity, and overall performance in high-temperature scenarios. It involves systematic evaluations that may utilize both experimental and analytical approaches, ensuring that materials can withstand fire-related challenges. This classification is distinct from other inspection methods that focus on different types of physical or mechanical properties, destructive testing, stability assessments, or specific analytical techniques related to material examination.

a process involving the assessment of the functionality and performance characteristics of materials and components to ensure they meet specified requirements. This evaluation aims to determine the operational effectiveness and reliability under defined conditions, often utilizing various testing methodologies to simulate real-world applications. The objective is to identify any potential issues or limitations in functionality, thereby ensuring that the materials and components are suitable for their intended use. This classification emphasizes the importance of thorough evaluation to guarantee quality and compliance within manufacturing or production settings.

keywords.label: Examination of fatigue patterns and permanent use properties
Examination of permanent use properties

definition.text: this classification encompasses advanced methodologies employed to evaluate the integrity, performance, and characteristics of materials and components through intricate testing procedures. These methods are designed to assess various attributes, including physical, chemical, and mechanical properties, often utilizing sophisticated equipment and techniques. The focus is on ensuring compliance with industry standards and specifications while identifying potential defects or weaknesses that may impact functionality or safety. This classification is distinct from other examination techniques that emphasize different aspects of material and component assessment, highlighting its unique approach to thorough and comprehensive evaluation processes.

this category encompasses assessment techniques focused on the oscillatory characteristics of materials and components, ensuring their performance and reliability under dynamic conditions. The evaluation process involves analyzing the response of materials to oscillating forces or vibrations, providing insights into their structural integrity and potential failure modes. This classification emphasizes methods that do not alter the material's physical properties, allowing for the detection of defects or inconsistencies while preserving the sample. Applications may range across various industries where material performance under oscillatory stress is critical, thereby facilitating informed decisions regarding design, manufacturing, and quality assurance.
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

this category encompasses educational programs and resources aimed at enhancing knowledge and skills in the field of building management. It includes various forms of training, workshops, and courses designed for individuals seeking to advance their expertise in managing building operations, maintenance, and related services. The focus is on practical and theoretical aspects that support effective building management practices, ensuring that participants gain comprehensive insights into the industry standards, regulations, and best practices. This classification is distinct from other training areas, reflecting a specialized approach to developing competencies specifically related to the management of physical structures and their associated systems.

this classification pertains to services focused on the development and enhancement of skills and knowledge through structured educational methods. It encompasses a range of activities designed to facilitate learning, including workshops, seminars, and hands-on training programs. The aim is to improve individual or organizational capabilities in specific areas of expertise. This category is distinct from other service offerings related to trade, consulting, financial transactions, hospitality, property management, engineering, and automotive sectors, which may not primarily focus on the educational aspect of skill development. The services classified here are characterized by their emphasis on practical application and experiential learning, contributing to personal and professional growth.

this classification encompasses specialized services aimed at enhancing knowledge and skills through structured learning experiences. It includes a variety of educational offerings designed to improve the proficiency of individuals in specific areas of engineering. The services may be delivered through various formats such as workshops, seminars, or online courses, and can be tailored to meet the needs of different audiences, including professionals seeking to update their skills or individuals pursuing new qualifications. This classification is distinct from other service categories that focus on retail, wholesale, international trade, general consulting, financial assistance, hospitality, building management, processing, or automotive sectors. It emphasizes a commitment to fostering professional development and technical expertise in engineering disciplines.

this classification encompasses services related to the automotive sector that focus on educational and developmental opportunities. This classification is distinct from other service areas that provide similar educational opportunities in fields such as retail, wholesale, international trade, general service, consulting, finance, hospitality, building management, processing, or engineering, ensuring a specialized focus on the automotive industry's unique requirements for training and further professional development.

this classification encompasses educational programs and courses focused on the development and enhancement of skills related to information technology. It covers a wide range of subjects, including software development, network management, and data processing, aimed at equipping individuals with the knowledge and competencies necessary to navigate and leverage technology in various contexts. The training provided may include practical applications, theoretical foundations, and emerging trends in the field. This category is distinct from others that focus on different scientific, health, industrial, or artistic disciplines, ensuring a specialized approach to the unique challenges and advancements in information technology. The offerings may cater to various proficiency levels, from introductory courses to advanced training, supporting continuous professional growth and adaptation to an ever-evolving digital landscape.

this classification encompasses educational offerings related to the effective use and management of application software within the field of information technology. It includes various training programs aimed at enhancing skills and knowledge in using specific application tools and software solutions, which are essential for professionals seeking to improve their proficiency in IT applications. The training may cover a broad range of topics, such as software utilization, application integration, and practical problem-solving techniques. This classification is distinct from other training categories that focus on operating systems, new media technologies, general data processing, hardware, support services, internet applications, network security, software development, telecommunications, and database management.

preferred_name.label: Operating systems information technology (training, further training)

definition.text: this category encompasses educational programs and resources focused on operating systems within the field of information technology. It includes training and further training opportunities designed to enhance knowledge and skills related to the installation, configuration, management, and troubleshooting of various operating systems. The offerings may cover a range of topics, including system architecture, command-line interfaces, user interface design, and security considerations. This classification is distinct from other areas of information technology training, such as application software, data processing, or network technologies, emphasizing the unique aspects of operating system management and functionality in an educational context.

preferred_name.label: New media, CAD, CAM, DTP (training, further training)

definition.text: this category encompasses educational programs and resources focused on contemporary media technologies, computer-aided design (CAD), computer-aided manufacturing (CAM), and desktop publishing (DTP). It includes training and further education opportunities aimed at enhancing skills and knowledge in the use of software and tools relevant to these areas. The offerings may include workshops, courses, certifications, and materials designed to equip individuals with the necessary competencies to effectively utilize new media technologies and design tools in various professional contexts. This classification is distinct from other areas related to information technology training that emphasize application software, operating systems, general data processing, hardware, technical support, internet technologies, network security, software development, telecommunications, and database management.

this category encompasses educational programs and resources focused on the principles, practices, and methodologies of data processing. It includes training aimed at enhancing skills in managing, analyzing, and utilizing data effectively across various applications. The offerings may cover a broad range of topics, such as data management techniques, data analysis tools, and best practices for data handling in diverse environments. This classification is distinct from other specialized training areas within the information technology domain, emphasizing a more general approach to data processing education rather than specific applications, operating systems, or technological tools. The objective is to equip individuals with foundational knowledge and competencies necessary for effective data processing in a variety of contexts.

preferred_name.label: Hardware, technical computer science (training, further training)

definition.text: this category encompasses educational resources and training programs specifically focused on the hardware aspects of computer science. It includes materials and courses that enhance knowledge and skills related to the physical components of computer systems, such as processors, memory, storage devices, and peripheral equipment. The emphasis is placed on understanding the design, functionality, maintenance, and troubleshooting of hardware systems. This classification is distinct from other educational offerings that concentrate on software applications, operating systems, new media technologies, general data processing, support services, internet commerce, network technologies, software engineering, telecommunications, and database management.

this classification encompasses services and resources focused on providing assistance, guidance, and education in the use of information technology systems. It includes training programs designed to enhance users' skills in utilizing various IT tools and platforms effectively. The offerings may range from introductory courses to advanced training sessions, aimed at improving proficiency and understanding of support mechanisms within IT environments. The emphasis is on equipping individuals or organizations with the necessary knowledge and skills to address technical issues, optimize system usage, and enhance overall performance in IT-related tasks.

this category encompasses educational resources and programs focused on the digital landscape of business operations, including the utilization of the internet for commercial activities. It covers training and further education aimed at enhancing skills in online business strategies, digital marketing, e-commerce platforms, and the management of internet-based transactions. The offerings may include courses, workshops, and certifications that equip individuals with the necessary knowledge to navigate the evolving online marketplace effectively. Emphasis is placed on practical applications and current trends within the realm of digital commerce, ensuring participants are prepared for the challenges and opportunities presented by the growing reliance on internet technology in business.

preferred_name.label: Network technology, network security (training, further training)

definition.text: this category encompasses educational offerings focused on the principles, practices, and technologies related to network infrastructure and security. It includes training programs aimed at enhancing skills in protecting, managing, and optimizing networks against threats and vulnerabilities. The curriculum may cover topics such as network protocols, security measures, risk assessment, and incident response strategies. Participants are equipped to understand network architectures and the tools necessary for safeguarding data integrity and confidentiality in various environments. This classification is distinct from other training offerings that cover different aspects of information technology, ensuring a specialized focus on network-related security knowledge and skills development.

this classification encompasses educational offerings aimed at enhancing knowledge and skills in software development practices. It includes various training programs, workshops, and courses designed to equip individuals with the necessary competencies to design, develop, and maintain software applications. The focus is on methodologies, tools, and techniques relevant to the software lifecycle, including programming languages, software engineering principles, and project management. This category is distinct from other educational offerings related to application technology, operating systems, new media, general data processing, hardware, support services, internet technologies, network security, telecommunications, and database management. The emphasis is on fostering practical and theoretical understanding to facilitate effective software development in various environments.

this classification encompasses educational offerings and programs that focus on the field of telecommunications, specifically designed for both initial learning and ongoing professional development. It includes a range of instructional methods and content aimed at enhancing knowledge and skills related to telecommunication technologies, systems, and services. The training may cover various aspects such as signal processing, network architecture, communication protocols, and emerging technologies in the telecommunications sector. This classification is distinct from other educational offerings in the information technology domain that address different areas such as application software, operating systems, new media, general data processing, and technical support. It emphasizes the unique attributes and requirements of training in telecommunications, catering to both individuals and organizations seeking to advance their expertise in this critical area of technology.

this category encompasses resources and educational materials focused on the acquisition and enhancement of skills related to database management and operations. It includes training programs, workshops, and courses designed to educate individuals on the principles, tools, and techniques used in the design, implementation, and maintenance of databases. Participants will learn about data storage, retrieval, and organization, as well as the utilization of various database management systems. This classification serves to differentiate offerings specifically aimed at developing expertise in database technologies, distinguishing them from other areas of information technology training that cover broader topics such as software development, network security, or general data processing.
