this classification pertains to the specialized area of manufacturing services focused on the production of pharmaceutical products intended for administration via the gastrointestinal tract. It encompasses the processes involved in the formulation, production, and packaging of various dosage forms that are designed for enteral delivery. This category emphasizes the contractual arrangement wherein a service provider undertakes the manufacturing responsibilities on behalf of a pharmaceutical company, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards and quality assurance protocols specific to the pharmaceutical industry. The offerings include a diverse range of dosage forms, each tailored to meet specific therapeutic requirements and patient needs, while adhering to the highest standards of safety and efficacy in pharmaceutical manufacturing.

this category encompasses oral dosage forms primarily designed for pharmaceutical applications through contract manufacturing, specifically targeting enteral administration. These formulations are characterized by their standardized composition and design, ensuring consistent quality and therapeutic efficacy. They are typically utilized in various therapeutic areas and are produced under stringent regulatory guidelines to meet safety and efficacy standards. The products within this category are distinct from other formulations such as coated tablets, effervescent tablets, powders, granules, capsules, suppositories, drops, and syrups, each having unique characteristics and manufacturing specifications tailored to specific therapeutic needs or patient requirements.

a type of pharmaceutical formulation characterized by solid dosage forms that are coated with a sweet or flavored layer, intended for enteral administration. This formulation is designed to improve taste, mask unpleasant flavors, enhance patient compliance, and facilitate easier swallowing. It is produced through specialized manufacturing processes specific to the pharmaceutical industry, ensuring adherence to regulatory standards for safety and efficacy. This category encompasses products that are specifically developed for oral intake and are often utilized in various therapeutic applications, offering a controlled release of active ingredients within the digestive system.

a film-coated tablet is a pharmaceutical formulation designed for enteral administration, characterized by a thin polymeric film coating that enhances the tablet's appearance, stability, and swallowability. This coating can modify the release profile of the active ingredients, providing controlled or delayed release, thereby improving patient compliance and therapeutic outcomes. Film-coated tablets are typically produced under contract manufacturing arrangements, ensuring adherence to specific quality standards and regulatory requirements. This classification distinguishes it from other oral dosage forms that may have different coatings or formulations, such as standard tablets, sugar-coated tablets, effervescent tablets, powders, granules, capsules, suppositories, drops, and syrups.

an effervescent tablet is a solid dosage form that releases carbon dioxide when it comes into contact with water, resulting in a fizzy solution. This type of pharmaceutical product is designed for enteral administration, ensuring that the active ingredients are delivered effectively when dissolved. It is typically composed of a mixture of acids and carbonates, which react to produce the effervescence. The formulation is often enhanced with flavoring agents to improve palatability. Effervescent tablets are distinguished from other solid dosage forms by their unique disintegration and dissolution characteristics, making them suitable for patients who may have difficulty swallowing traditional tablets or capsules.

this classification encompasses powdered substances specifically produced for pharmaceutical contract manufacturing intended for enteral administration. These powders are typically formulated to ensure compatibility and effectiveness for oral intake, facilitating accurate dosing and therapeutic efficacy. The classification distinctly identifies these powders from other dosage forms, such as tablets, capsules, and liquid preparations, emphasizing their unique characteristics and applications in pharmaceutical processes. The focus is on the formulation, quality standards, and manufacturing practices that ensure safety and effectiveness for patients requiring enteral therapies.

preferred_name.label: Granule, dry sirup (pharmaceutical contract manufacturing, enteral)

definition.text: a finely processed substance that is prepared in a dry form, typically utilized in the pharmaceutical industry for enteral applications. This type of product is characterized by its granulated consistency, allowing for ease of handling and incorporation into various formulations. It serves as an essential ingredient in the production of medicinal products designed for delivery through the gastrointestinal tract. The distinct properties of this substance enable tailored formulations that meet specific therapeutic needs, differentiating it from other pharmaceutical forms such as tablets, capsules, powders, and liquid preparations intended for enteral use. This classification highlights the unique characteristics and applications of dry granule formulations in pharmaceutical contract manufacturing.

a type of dosage form utilized in the pharmaceutical industry, characterized by its solid shell structure that encases active ingredients or formulations, designed for oral administration. This form is typically composed of two halves that fit together, allowing for the encapsulation of powders, granules, or other substances. The hard capsule format is favored for its ability to provide precise dosing, enhance stability, and improve the release profile of the encapsulated material. It is particularly relevant in enteral applications, where the capsule can facilitate the direct delivery of medication to the gastrointestinal tract, ensuring effective absorption and bioavailability of the active components. This dosage form is distinct from other pharmaceutical preparations that may vary in texture, coating, or delivery mechanism.

a soft capsule is a dosage form used in pharmaceutical applications, characterized by its flexible, gelatinous outer shell that encloses liquid or semi-solid substances. This delivery format allows for enhanced bioavailability of active ingredients, providing an effective means for oral administration. Soft capsules are particularly beneficial for encapsulating oils, nutrients, and other compounds that may be difficult to formulate in solid forms. They are commonly employed in enteral pharmaceutical contract manufacturing, where precision and quality control are paramount in meeting therapeutic requirements. The distinct formulation and production processes that differentiate soft capsules from other types of oral dosage forms ensure their unique position within the pharmaceutical landscape.

a type of pharmaceutical formulation designed for enteral administration, specifically created in the context of contract manufacturing. This formulation is characterized by its solid form, which is intended to dissolve in the gastrointestinal tract, providing a means of delivering active ingredients effectively. Its design and composition cater to specific therapeutic needs, ensuring that the intended effects are achieved while considering factors such as absorption, bioavailability, and patient compliance. This category encompasses products that are tailored for various medical applications, highlighting the versatility and customization inherent in pharmaceutical manufacturing processes for enteral routes of administration.

this classification encompasses a category of pharmaceutical formulations specifically designed for enteral administration. These formulations are characterized by their liquid state and are intended for use in medical applications where delivery through the gastrointestinal tract is required. The products in this category may vary in composition, viscosity, and intended therapeutic outcomes, differentiating them from other solid and semi-solid dosage forms. The focus is on solutions that facilitate the administration of active pharmaceutical ingredients in a manner that ensures effective absorption and bioavailability when consumed.

this classification encompasses a range of viscous liquid formulations specifically designed for pharmaceutical applications, particularly those intended for enteral administration. These products are characterized by their sweetened or flavored nature, serving various therapeutic purposes. They may be utilized in different dosage forms to deliver active pharmaceutical ingredients effectively. This category is distinct from other liquid formulations and solid dosage forms, emphasizing the unique characteristics and functionalities of syrup formulations within the context of contract manufacturing for pharmaceutical products.
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

preferred_name.label: Mechanical engineering, equipment manufacturer (training, further training)

definition.text: this classification encompasses educational and training offerings focused on the field of mechanical engineering and the manufacturing of related equipment. It includes specialized programs aimed at enhancing skills and knowledge in various areas such as mechanical components, lubrication, propulsion technology, and machine tools. The offerings also cover advanced topics like hydraulic and pneumatic automation, robotics, and handling technology. This classification is distinct from other educational fields such as natural sciences, health services, and information technology, emphasizing a practical and technical approach to engineering disciplines. The training is designed for individuals seeking to deepen their expertise in mechanical engineering applications across various industries, ensuring they are well-equipped to meet the demands of evolving technologies and manufacturing processes.

a collection of interconnected components designed to regulate and facilitate the movement of fluids within a system. This assembly is engineered to optimize the flow characteristics of various liquids or gases, ensuring efficient performance in applications where fluid dynamics are critical. It typically encompasses elements such as pumps, valves, pipes, and control instruments, all integrated to function cohesively. This category is distinguished by its focus on fluid management and movement, setting it apart from other assembly types that may involve different operational principles or specialized applications. The assembly is utilized across various industries, ensuring reliable and effective fluid transfer and control in diverse operational environments.

a collection of components and systems designed specifically for the purpose of cleaning, which may include various assemblies intended for the removal of contaminants, dirt, and impurities from surfaces or items. This category encompasses installations that may incorporate mechanical, chemical, or thermal processes to achieve effective cleaning results. The designs can vary widely based on the intended application, ranging from simple manual systems to complex automated setups. These installations are essential in maintaining hygiene and operational efficiency across various industries, ensuring that products or surfaces meet required cleanliness standards.

a media supply device designed for conditioning purposes is an assembly that facilitates the management and distribution of various media types within a system. This device plays a critical role in ensuring the proper preparation and delivery of resources necessary for operational processes. It is distinguished from other assembly-related technologies by its specific function in media conditioning, which may involve processes such as filtering, regulating, or enhancing the quality of the supplied media. Such devices are integral to systems requiring precise media handling and are often employed in environments where optimal media conditions are essential for performance and efficiency.

a category encompassing tools specifically designed for the assembly of machinery, focusing on the precision and efficiency of joining components in various manufacturing processes. These tools facilitate the construction and integration of parts, ensuring optimal functionality and performance of machinery. The classification highlights tools that are integral to the assembly phase, distinguishing them from other equipment used for different purposes such as industry-specific assembly or process engineering apparatus. This category is essential for manufacturers seeking reliable solutions for assembling complex machinery systems while maintaining high standards of quality and productivity.

this category encompasses techniques and devices specifically designed for the assembly of components and systems. It includes various methods and tools utilized to facilitate the effective organization, positioning, and connection of parts during the assembly process. The focus is on optimizing the workflow and efficiency of assembly tasks, ensuring precision and reliability in the final product. This classification is distinct from other assembly-related categories that cater to specific industries or types of equipment, emphasizing general handling techniques applicable across various assembly scenarios.

this classification encompasses devices and systems specifically designed for conducting tests and evaluations within various assembly processes. These machines and systems facilitate the assessment of performance, reliability, and quality of assembled products or components. They are utilized in diverse industries to ensure that assembly operations meet specified standards and requirements. The equipment may include automated testing solutions, diagnostic systems, and integrated test setups that provide precise measurements and feedback during the assembly phase. This classification is distinct from those focused on industry-specific assembly processes, process engineering apparatus, fluid flow mechanisms, cleaning installations, media supply and conditioning devices, machine tools, handling technologies, complete installations, gear units, materials-handling and storage solutions, and surface technology applications.

a comprehensive configuration that includes all necessary components and systems for the effective setup of machinery or equipment, ensuring proper functionality upon installation. This setup typically encompasses various elements such as structural supports, connections, and integration of operational systems, designed to facilitate the seamless operation of the assembled equipment. It may involve both standard and specialized components, tailored to meet specific operational needs, and is essential for achieving optimal performance and reliability in the intended application. This configuration is distinct from other assembly types that cater to specific industry requirements or specialized functions.

a gear unit (assembly) refers to a mechanical component designed to transmit power and motion between different parts of a machine or system. It typically consists of a set of gears arranged within a housing, which may include additional elements such as bearings, seals, and lubrication systems. This assembly is engineered to optimize performance by adjusting speed, torque, and direction of rotation in various applications. Gear units are commonly utilized in a wide range of machinery and equipment, providing essential functionality in processes where precise control of mechanical movement is required. The design and construction of these assemblies may vary based on specific operational needs and industry requirements.

this category encompasses technologies and equipment specifically designed for the handling, storage, and management of materials within assembly processes. It includes various systems and devices that facilitate the efficient movement, organization, and preservation of materials during assembly operations. The focus is on enhancing productivity and safety in assembly environments by utilizing specialized tools, mechanisms, and methodologies tailored to optimize material flow and storage solutions. This classification distinguishes itself through its emphasis on general handling and storage technologies, as opposed to equipment tailored for specific industrial applications or processes.

this classification encompasses technologies and processes related to surface treatment and enhancement specifically in the context of assembly operations. It includes techniques and equipment designed to modify or improve the surface characteristics of materials to ensure optimal performance, durability, and compatibility during the assembly of products or systems. The focus is on processes that may involve coatings, treatments, or modifications to surfaces to meet specific functional requirements. This category is distinct from other assembly-related classifications that pertain to industry-specific applications, apparatus designed for process engineering, fluid management systems, cleaning systems, media supply and conditioning devices, machine tools, handling technologies, testing systems, complete assembly installations, gear units, and storage technologies.

preferred_name.label: General handicraft, industry, technology (training, further training)

definition.text: this classification encompasses educational programs and initiatives that focus on practical skills and knowledge in various craft and industrial disciplines. It includes training aimed at enhancing competencies in areas such as manual skills, technology applications, and innovative practices relevant to various trades. The offerings are designed to support individuals in acquiring technical expertise and hands-on experience necessary for careers in diverse fields, emphasizing craftsmanship and technological advancements. Educational content may cover a range of topics, including but not limited to traditional crafts, modern manufacturing processes, and emerging technologies. This category is distinct from other specialized training areas, providing a broad foundation for skill development in the handicraft and industrial sectors.

this classification encompasses a broad range of activities and resources related to the development of skills and knowledge in various handicraft disciplines. It includes educational programs, workshops, and training modules that aim to enhance practical abilities in crafting and creative pursuits. The focus is on fostering an understanding of techniques, tools, and materials used in the handicraft sector, thereby promoting both personal and professional growth. This category serves individuals seeking to improve their craftsmanship, whether for personal enrichment or as part of vocational training, and is distinct from other specialized training areas within technology and industry.

this classification encompasses educational offerings and resources related to a broad range of technological disciplines, emphasizing skill development and knowledge enhancement in various technical fields. It includes training programs, courses, and materials that focus on advancing expertise in general technological practices, methodologies, and innovations. The content is designed for individuals seeking to improve their capabilities and understanding in technology-related areas, facilitating personal and professional growth. This classification serves as a foundational element for those pursuing careers or interests in diverse technological applications across multiple industries.

this classification refers to the education and training related to the processing of wood. It encompasses various learning opportunities aimed at enhancing skills and knowledge in techniques, tools, and methodologies pertinent to woodcraft and wood product manufacturing. This area of study may include practical hands-on training, theoretical courses, and workshops that cover safety practices, design principles, and advanced processing technologies. The aim is to prepare individuals for careers in woodworking and related industries by providing comprehensive insights into the craftsmanship and technology involved in this field.

this category encompasses educational programs and resources focused on the techniques, skills, and knowledge required for metalworking. It includes both introductory and advanced training opportunities aimed at individuals seeking to enhance their expertise in the manipulation and processing of metals. The offerings may cover a range of topics such as machining, welding, metal fabrication, and tool usage, providing practical experience and theoretical understanding. This classification is distinct from other educational areas related to handicrafts, technology, and various industries, emphasizing the specific requirements and methodologies associated with metalworking training and development.

this category encompasses educational programs and resources focused on the principles, practices, and technologies related to electric trade. It includes training modules aimed at enhancing skills for working with electrical systems, components, and installations. The offerings may cover a variety of topics, such as electrical theory, safety standards, installation techniques, maintenance practices, and troubleshooting methods. Designed for individuals seeking to enter or advance in the electric trade field, these programs may cater to various levels of expertise, from introductory courses to advanced training. The emphasis is on providing practical knowledge and hands-on experience to equip learners for careers in electrical work, ensuring they are prepared to meet industry demands and standards.

this category encompasses educational programs and training initiatives focused on the principles and practices of fashion design. It includes a variety of learning opportunities aimed at developing skills in creative design, garment construction, textile selection, and fashion merchandising. The content is tailored to equip individuals with the necessary knowledge and techniques to succeed in the fashion industry, whether in apparel design, accessory creation, or fashion marketing. The training may involve both theoretical understanding and practical application, ensuring that participants are well-prepared for careers in various fashion-related fields. This classification is distinct from other areas of vocational training that pertain to general handicrafts, technology, and various trades.

definition.text: this classification encompasses educational programs and courses focused on the principles and practices of garden and landscape gardening. definition.text: this classification encompasses educational programs and professional development opportunities focused on the principles and practices of building management and engineering. It includes training that enhances skills in the management of building operations, maintenance, systems integration, and energy efficiency, as well as advanced techniques in building design and construction. The aim is to equip individuals with the necessary competencies to effectively oversee building infrastructure, ensuring safety, sustainability, and compliance with regulations. This area of training is distinct from other disciplines, emphasizing the unique challenges and methodologies related to the built environment, including the integration of technological advancements in building management systems.

a category focused on the educational and developmental programs aimed at enhancing knowledge and skills related to security measures and protocols within a factory setting. This encompasses a range of training activities that prepare individuals to recognize potential security threats, implement safety procedures, and respond effectively to incidents. It may include practical training sessions, theoretical coursework, and hands-on exercises designed to equip participants with the necessary competencies for ensuring a safe working environment. The emphasis is on fostering awareness and proficiency in security practices pertinent to industrial operations, contributing to the overall safety and efficiency of the workplace.

this classification pertains to educational offerings and resources focused on the broad field of industry, encompassing various sectors and specializations aimed at enhancing skills and knowledge. It includes programs and materials designed for both foundational and advanced learning, catering to individuals seeking to improve their understanding and capabilities within industrial contexts. The emphasis is on practical and theoretical training that supports career development and professional growth in a variety of industrial applications, ensuring participants are equipped with relevant competencies to meet the demands of contemporary industry. The classification recognizes the diverse nature of training in this domain, allowing for a comprehensive approach to skill enhancement across multiple sectors.

this classification encompasses educational programs and resources focused on the principles, practices, and advancements related to automotive technology. It includes training and further education aimed at enhancing skills and knowledge in areas such as vehicle mechanics, electronic systems, and innovative automotive solutions. The aim is to equip individuals with the necessary competencies to excel in various automotive sectors, promoting both theoretical understanding and practical application. This classification is distinct from other educational offerings that focus on different technological fields and crafts, highlighting the unique aspects of automotive engineering and its relevance in contemporary industry practices.

this classification encompasses educational programs and training modules specifically focused on solar technology. It includes curricula designed to impart knowledge and skills related to the installation, maintenance, and innovation of solar energy systems. The offerings may cover a range of topics, such as photovoltaic technology, solar thermal systems, energy efficiency, and sustainability practices. Participants in these programs are equipped with the expertise needed to work in the renewable energy sector, promoting the use of solar solutions for various applications. This classification aims to support the development of a skilled workforce capable of advancing solar technology and contributing to a sustainable energy future.

this classification encompasses a variety of educational and professional development services aimed at enhancing skills and knowledge within the trade sector. It covers training programs designed to equip individuals with the necessary competencies for roles in retail, wholesale, international trade, and various consulting and service-oriented businesses. The focus is on practical applications and methodologies relevant to trade operations, including financial services, hospitality management, and engineering support. This classification is distinct from other educational sectors by emphasizing trade-specific knowledge and practices, fostering both personal and professional growth in a competitive marketplace. The services provided may range from basic skill development to advanced training in specialized areas, ensuring a comprehensive approach to workforce empowerment in the trade industry.

this classification encompasses services related to the retail sector focused on training and further education. It includes activities that provide knowledge and skills to individuals or organizations in the retail trade environment. The offerings may range from basic retail skills to advanced techniques in customer service, sales strategies, and inventory management. These services are tailored to enhance the proficiency of employees within retail businesses, ensuring they are equipped to meet the evolving demands of the market. This classification is distinct from other educational services that pertain to wholesale, international trade, general service, consulting, financial services, hospitality, building management, processing, engineering, and automotive sectors, focusing specifically on the unique needs and practices of retail trade.

this classification pertains to the provision of educational services aimed at enhancing skills and knowledge in a wholesale context. It encompasses organized programs and courses designed for individuals or groups involved in wholesale operations, including but not limited to sales techniques, supply chain management, inventory control, and market analysis. The focus is on improving proficiency and effectiveness in wholesale trade practices, distinct from other forms of trade or service, such as retail or international settings. These training initiatives may be delivered through various formats, including workshops, seminars, online courses, and hands-on training, tailored to meet the specific needs of participants engaged in wholesale activities.

this classification encompasses services focused on international trade education and skill enhancement. It includes programs designed to equip individuals and organizations with the knowledge and competencies necessary to navigate the complexities of global commerce. The offerings can range from foundational training in import and export procedures to advanced courses in international market analysis, trade regulations, and cross-cultural communication. The emphasis is on enhancing trade-related capabilities that enable participants to engage effectively in the global marketplace, facilitating the exchange of goods and services across borders. This category is distinct from other educational services that focus on domestic retail, wholesale, consulting, financial, hospitality, building management, processing, engineering, and automotive sectors.

this classification encompasses a variety of services aimed at enhancing knowledge, skills, and competencies through structured learning experiences. It includes offerings designed for individuals or groups seeking to improve their professional or personal abilities. Services in this category may range from workshops and seminars to online courses and certification programs. These educational opportunities can be tailored to various industries and skill levels, fostering continuous development and adaptation in a rapidly changing environment. The focus is on delivering training that is not limited to a specific sector, but rather provides a broad foundation for advancement across multiple fields.

a professional service focused on enhancing knowledge and skills through structured instruction and guidance. This offering is designed to support individuals or organizations in achieving specific learning objectives, improving competencies, and fostering professional development. It encompasses a variety of educational methods, including workshops, seminars, and personalized coaching, aimed at delivering practical insights and strategies. The service may cater to diverse audiences, addressing unique needs and industry-specific challenges, while emphasizing continuous improvement and adaptability in a dynamic learning environment.

a category focusing on specialized offerings aimed at enhancing financial knowledge and skills through organized instructional programs. This encompasses various educational formats, including workshops, online courses, and personalized coaching, designed for individuals or organizations seeking to improve their understanding of financial concepts, instruments, and strategies. The emphasis is on promoting professional growth and competence in financial management, investment practices, and economic principles, enabling participants to navigate the complexities of finance effectively.

preferred_name.label: Hotel service, restaurant service (training, further training)

definition.text: a type of service focused on providing educational and skill development opportunities in the hospitality sector, specifically tailored for individuals seeking to enhance their expertise in managing hotel operations and restaurant services. This offering includes structured programs that may encompass practical training, theoretical knowledge, and hands-on experience aimed at improving service delivery in dining and accommodation settings. The programs are designed for various levels of experience and can cater to both newcomers and seasoned professionals looking to further their careers in the hospitality industry.

a financial instrument that allows two parties to exchange interest rate payments on a specified principal amount over a predetermined period. This agreement typically involves one party paying a fixed interest rate while receiving a variable rate, or vice versa, based on a reference rate. It is primarily used for managing exposure to fluctuations in interest rates, enabling entities to hedge against interest rate risk or speculate on future interest rate movements. The agreement is settled at the end of the contract period, with no exchange of principal, and is commonly utilized by financial institutions and corporations to optimize their interest rate profiles and enhance financial planning.

a financial instrument that involves the exchange of interest rate cash flows between two parties, based on a specified notional amount and predetermined interest rates. These instruments are primarily utilized for managing exposure to fluctuations in interest rates, enabling entities to optimize their financial positioning and reduce risk. They can be tailored to meet specific financial goals, allowing for flexibility in payment structures and durations. Interest swaps play a critical role in the financial services sector by providing mechanisms for hedging, speculating, and achieving better alignment between assets and liabilities in terms of interest rate exposure.

a financial instrument that grants the holder the right, but not the obligation, to enter into an interest rate swap agreement at a predetermined future date. This type of derivative is utilized for managing interest rate exposure and can be employed for speculative purposes or to hedge against fluctuations in interest rates. The instrument allows for flexibility in interest rate management strategies and can be tailored to meet specific financial goals by adjusting terms such as notional amount, expiration date, and fixed versus floating rates. The distinct characteristics of this instrument differentiate it from other financial services that involve interest management, providing unique opportunities for risk mitigation and financial planning.

this classification encompasses financial instruments and services specifically designed for managing interest-related aspects of investments and liabilities. It includes various products that help individuals or organizations optimize their interest exposure, enhance returns, or mitigate risks associated with interest rate fluctuations. The focus is on tools that facilitate the strategic administration of interest, catering to diverse financial objectives and market conditions. This classification does not include other financial instruments that address interest management but are categorized under different classifications, ensuring a distinct and specialized grouping for effective identification and utilization.

a classification that encompasses various financial instruments and agreements specifically designed to manage and mitigate interest rate risk. This category includes tools that allow entities to manage their exposure to fluctuations in interest rates, often used by businesses and financial institutions to stabilize cash flows and optimize financial performance. These instruments may involve contractual arrangements that enable the transfer of interest rate risk between parties, ensuring that the financial impact of changing rates is effectively controlled. This classification is distinct from other financial management instruments that focus on different aspects of interest rate exposure or provide alternative methods of investment and financing.
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

this classification encompasses services related to the strategic planning and execution of media initiatives aimed at promoting products or services. It includes activities focused on the design and implementation of advertising campaigns across various media channels, ensuring effective audience reach and engagement. The offerings involve the management of advertisement placements, development of creative content for different formats, and assessment of coverage costs associated with various media outlets. This classification also addresses services that facilitate the analysis of media effectiveness and audience metrics, thereby enabling informed decision-making in marketing strategies. The emphasis is on delivering tailored media solutions that align with clients' marketing goals, enhancing brand visibility and consumer interaction.

this classification refers to services that involve the strategic placement and dissemination of promotional content through various broadcasting channels. It encompasses the activities related to presenting advertisements via audio-visual media, ensuring that the promotional message reaches the intended audience effectively. This category is distinct from other advertising and promotional services by focusing specifically on the broadcast aspect, emphasizing the delivery method rather than the creation or conceptualization of the advertising content. It includes diverse formats and platforms to maximize audience engagement and brand visibility through scheduled placements in media broadcasts.
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

this category encompasses services related to the strategic development and creative formulation of media campaigns. It involves the conceptualization and planning of media initiatives aimed at effectively reaching target audiences through various channels. The focus is on understanding audience behavior, selecting appropriate media platforms, and integrating different media elements to create cohesive marketing strategies. Services in this category prioritize the design and structure of media content and its delivery, rather than the direct execution of advertising placements or the costs associated with specific advertisements. This includes research, analysis, and recommendations for optimal media usage to enhance brand visibility and engagement.

preferred_name.label: Advertisement in specialist journal (coverage costs, marketing)

definition.text: this classification encompasses the costs associated with placing advertisements in specialized journals tailored to specific industries or professional audiences. It includes expenses related to the design, creation, and placement of ads that aim to reach targeted readers who are likely to have a particular interest or professional connection to the subject matter. This category specifically addresses promotional activities intended for niche markets, distinguishing it from broader media placements or other forms of advertising in more general publications. It reflects the strategic investment in targeted marketing efforts to enhance visibility and engagement within specialized sectors.

this classification encompasses services related to the promotion and marketing of products or services through printed publications that are widely distributed. It includes expenses associated with placing advertisements in magazines that target specific demographics or interests, aiming to enhance brand visibility and reach potential customers. The focus is on costs incurred for coverage within these media outlets, facilitating strategic marketing efforts to effectively communicate messages to the audience. This classification is distinct from other advertising methods, emphasizing print media as a vital tool for marketing campaigns, while considering the financial aspects involved in utilizing such platforms for promotional purposes.

this category encompasses costs associated with placing advertisements in printed newspapers as part of marketing strategies. It includes expenses related to the creation, design, and publication of ads intended to reach a broad audience through newspaper media. The focus is on the financial aspects of advertising efforts that leverage newspapers as a medium for promoting products, services, or brands. This classification signifies a distinct approach within the broader media service offerings, specifically targeting traditional print advertising methods, and differentiates it from other forms of media advertising such as digital platforms, broadcast media, and specialized publications.

this category encompasses expenses associated with the broadcast of television advertisements. It includes costs incurred for the placement and airing of promotional content designed to reach a wide audience through television channels. These expenses may cover production costs, airtime fees, and any additional charges related to the campaign's execution. The focus is on maximizing visibility and engagement with potential customers through strategic scheduling and selection of television networks. This classification is distinct from other media-related services that involve different platforms or formats for advertising and marketing efforts.

this classification encompasses services related to the promotional use of radio broadcasting to reach a target audience. It includes costs associated with the placement and coverage of advertisements on radio stations, aimed at enhancing brand awareness and driving consumer engagement. The focus is on the financial aspects involved in utilizing radio as a medium for marketing campaigns, distinguishing it from other forms of media advertising. Services listed here specifically pertain to the strategic planning and execution of audio-based advertisements that leverage radio as a platform for effective communication with potential customers, while excluding other advertising formats such as print or visual media.

this classification refers to promotional content specifically designed for cinema presentations, focusing on the costs associated with coverage and marketing efforts. It encompasses financial aspects related to the production, placement, and dissemination of advertisements that are intended to be shown in cinema venues. This category is distinct from other media-related services by emphasizing the unique environment of cinema as a medium for advertising, highlighting its effectiveness in reaching audiences in a dynamic visual setting. The classification aims to facilitate the organization and management of marketing expenses associated with cinema advertising initiatives, ensuring clarity in financial reporting and analysis within the broader context of media services.

a specific type of promotional material designed to convey information or messages to a target audience, often utilized in marketing campaigns. This category encompasses various forms of printed or digital displays that aim to attract attention, enhance brand visibility, and communicate promotional content. These materials may be used in different contexts, including public spaces, events, or online platforms, and are integral to advertising strategies that focus on visual engagement. The offerings within this classification may vary in format, size, and distribution method, tailored to meet specific marketing objectives and audience preferences.

this classification encompasses services related to advertising that specifically focus on promoting products or services through various transportation mediums. It includes costs associated with reaching an audience while utilizing transportation options, thereby integrating marketing efforts into the travel and transit environments. The focus is on maximizing visibility and engagement by leveraging the unique characteristics of transportation channels, distinguishing it from other advertising methods that may not utilize the mobility aspect. This category aims to provide a framework for evaluating and managing the financial aspects of such advertising initiatives.

this category encompasses services related to the promotion and marketing of products directly to consumers, focusing on the costs associated with coverage in various marketing channels. It includes activities aimed at enhancing brand visibility through direct outreach methods, which may involve various forms of advertising and promotional strategies. The services within this classification are distinguished by their emphasis on direct engagement and interaction with the target audience, differing from broader media planning and conceptual design approaches, as well as other advertising formats that may lack a direct consumer interaction element.

this classification encompasses services related to the removal of material from a workpiece, typically performed by specialized external providers. The focus is on processes that effectively eliminate excess material through various techniques, ensuring precision and adherence to specified tolerances. This category is distinct from other subcontracted activities that involve application, transformation, or protection of surfaces. It includes a range of operations aimed at achieving desired shapes, finishes, or dimensions through methods such as drilling, milling, or grinding. Emphasis is placed on the capability and expertise of the subcontractor to handle specific material types and fulfill quality requirements, making it a vital aspect of manufacturing and production workflows.

this classification refers to the process of creating cylindrical holes or enlarging existing holes in various materials, typically through the use of specialized tools. The technique is often utilized in manufacturing and construction to achieve precise dimensions and smooth finishes. This category encompasses various methods of boring, which may involve both manual and automated processes, and can be applied to a wide range of materials. The activities classified here are distinct from other material removal techniques that focus on cutting, shaping, and finishing surfaces in different ways. This classification is essential for identifying specific subcontracting services that provide tailored boring solutions to meet particular project requirements.

keywords.label: Drilling work (service, chip removal, not manually)

definition.text: this classification encompasses services that involve the process of cutting materials into specific shapes and sizes using various types of saws. It is characterized by the removal of material through mechanical means, typically involving the use of blades designed for efficient cutting. The focus is on subcontracted services where specialized expertise and equipment are utilized to achieve precise dimensions and surface finishes. This category is distinct from other machining processes that involve different techniques for material removal, such as drilling, sanding, and milling. The services categorized here are crucial in various manufacturing and construction applications, where accurate cutting is essential for the subsequent stages of production or assembly.

keywords.label: Sawing work (service, chip removal, not manually)

definition.text: this classification encompasses services involving the process of smoothing or polishing surfaces through the use of abrasives. It is primarily performed by external service providers and is essential in various industries where surface finish and precision are critical. The activities included in this classification may vary in technique and equipment but share the common goal of enhancing surface quality. This process is distinct from other material removal techniques that involve cutting or shaping materials through different methodologies. The focus is on achieving a refined surface finish, which can be crucial for both aesthetic and functional purposes in the final application.

keywords.label: Grinding work (service, chip removal, not manually)

definition.text: this classification encompasses the activities related to the process of planing, specifically when performed as a subcontracted service. Planing involves the removal of material from a workpiece to achieve a desired thickness or surface finish, utilizing specialized equipment designed for this purpose. The focus is on precision and efficiency in reshaping materials, which may include various substrates. This category is distinct from other machining processes that involve different techniques and equipment, such as boring, sawing, sanding, milling, machining, polishing, honing, lapping, and cutting. Services in this classification may include both manual and automated planing operations, tailored to meet specific requirements of the contracting entity.

keywords.label: Planing work (service, chip removal, not manually)

definition.text: a process involving the removal of material from a workpiece using mechanical means, specifically designed for the creation of flat surfaces or specific shapes. This technique is typically employed in manufacturing environments where precision is crucial, and it is often performed by specialized subcontractors who possess the necessary expertise and equipment. The focus is on achieving the desired dimensions and surface finish, thus enhancing the functionality and appearance of the final product. This process is distinct from other material removal methods that involve different techniques and outcomes, catering to a variety of production needs and specifications.

keywords.label: Milling work (service, chip removal, not manually)

definition.text: this classification encompasses services related to the removal of material from a workpiece through various machining processes performed by external contractors. It includes operations that utilize cutting tools to achieve desired shapes, dimensions, and surface finishes on metals and other materials. The focus is on subcontracted activities where specialized skills and equipment are employed to enhance production efficiency. This category specifically excludes other machining processes such as boring, sawing, sanding, planing, milling, polishing, honing, lapping, and cutting, which are recognized as distinct operations within the broader field of material removal. The services classified here are essential for industries seeking to optimize their manufacturing capabilities through outsourcing.

this classification refers to the process of refining a surface by abrasion to achieve a smoother finish or enhance the material's appearance. It typically involves the use of specialized tools and techniques to remove small amounts of material, resulting in a high-quality surface that meets specific aesthetic or functional requirements. This process is often performed by external service providers who specialize in surface treatment, ensuring precision and consistency in the finished product. The classification encompasses various methods and technologies used to achieve polishing, highlighting its distinct nature compared to other surface modification techniques that involve different approaches to material removal.

this classification encompasses processes involving the precise abrasion of surfaces to achieve specific dimensions and finishes. It is characterized by the use of specialized tools and techniques aimed at enhancing the surface quality of materials. The focus is on achieving tight tolerances and smooth finishes, which are essential in various manufacturing applications. This category is distinct from other similar processes, each having unique methodologies and outcomes tailored to different material properties and project requirements. The applications span across multiple industries where precision engineering and surface integrity are critical for the overall performance of the final product.

this category encompasses services that involve the precision finishing process known as lapping, where materials are polished or smoothed using abrasive particles in a fluid or paste. This technique is typically employed to achieve a high degree of flatness, surface finish, and dimensional accuracy on workpieces. It is often utilized in industries requiring meticulous surface treatment, such as manufacturing components for optical, electronic, or mechanical applications. The lapping service is characterized by its use of specialized equipment and techniques designed to enhance the quality and performance of the treated materials, distinguishing it from other subcontracted services focused on material removal or shaping through different methodologies.

this classification encompasses processes that involve the removal of material from a workpiece to achieve desired shapes and finishes through various cutting techniques. It includes activities that are typically outsourced to specialized service providers, reflecting a focus on efficiency and expertise in material processing. The methodologies used may vary significantly, relying on specific tools and techniques tailored to the material properties and the required precision of the final product. This category is distinct from other material removal processes that utilize alternative methods for achieving similar outcomes, each of which employs different operational principles and equipment to meet diverse manufacturing needs.

this classification encompasses educational programs and courses focused on the principles, practices, and advancements in the field of electrical technology. It includes various forms of training aimed at enhancing knowledge and skills related to electrical systems, devices, and applications. The offerings within this category cover a broad spectrum, from foundational concepts to specialized techniques in areas such as electric machines, power and control electronics, energy engineering, and sensor technologies. The objective is to equip individuals with the expertise required to operate, maintain, and innovate within the electrical technology sector, ensuring they remain competitive and knowledgeable in an evolving industry.

this category encompasses educational programs and training opportunities focused on pneumatic automation technology. It covers the principles, applications, and advancements in the use of compressed air for automation processes. Participants will gain insights into system design, operation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of pneumatic systems. The training is tailored for professionals seeking to enhance their expertise in pneumatic technologies, emphasizing practical skills and theoretical knowledge. The curriculum may include hands-on workshops, simulations, and case studies to foster a comprehensive understanding of pneumatic automation within mechanical engineering. This educational offering is distinct from other training areas related to mechanical engineering and equipment manufacturing, focusing specifically on pneumatic solutions and their implementation in various industrial applications.

this classification covers educational offerings related to hydraulic automation technology, focusing on the development of skills and knowledge necessary for the effective use, maintenance, and advancement of hydraulic systems within various industrial contexts. It encompasses training programs and further education initiatives that provide learners with insights into the principles of hydraulic systems, their components, and applications in automation. The educational content may include practical workshops, theoretical instruction, and hands-on experience, aimed at enhancing competency in hydraulic technologies. This classification is distinct from other specialized training areas related to mechanical engineering and automation, ensuring a focused approach to hydraulic system expertise.

preferred_name.label: Mechanical component, tribology, lubrication (training, further training)

definition.text: this classification encompasses items related to the study and application of mechanical components specifically focused on tribology and lubrication. It includes educational resources, materials, and tools designed for training and further training in understanding the principles of friction, wear, and lubrication mechanisms in mechanical systems. The subject matter addresses the design, analysis, and maintenance of components that enhance performance and efficiency through effective lubrication practices. The classification is distinct from other areas of mechanical engineering that focus on propulsion systems, conveyor systems, machine tools, engines, construction machinery, fine mechanics, apparatus engineering, hydraulic and pneumatic automation, as well as robotics and handling technologies. It aims to provide a comprehensive framework for advancing knowledge and skills in these specialized areas.

preferred_name.label: Propulsion technology, transmission technology (training, further training)

definition.text: this classification encompasses technologies and methodologies related to the design, implementation, and operation of propulsion systems and transmission mechanisms, specifically in the context of educational and professional development. It includes training programs and further education aimed at enhancing skills and knowledge in the areas of mechanical engineering focused on propulsion and transmission technologies. The classification distinguishes itself from other related fields by emphasizing the educational aspect of propulsion and transmission systems, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of their functionalities, applications, and advancements within the engineering sector. This classification is crucial for structuring educational content and resources aimed at professionals seeking to specialize in these specific technical areas.

preferred_name.label: Conveyor technology, bearing technology (training, further training)

definition.text: this classification encompasses training and further educational opportunities focused on technologies related to conveyor systems and bearing mechanisms. It includes instructional resources, workshops, and programs aimed at enhancing knowledge and skills necessary for the design, operation, and maintenance of conveyor technology and bearing applications within mechanical engineering contexts. The emphasis is on practical and theoretical aspects that support effective implementation and innovation in these areas. This category is distinct in its focus on the specific technologies and methodologies pertinent to conveyor systems and bearing technologies, differentiating it from other training programs related to various mechanical components and systems within the engineering sector.

this classification encompasses tools and equipment specifically designed for machining operations, as well as educational materials and resources aimed at enhancing skills in the use of such tools. It includes various types of machinery and devices used to shape, cut, or form materials, along with instructional programs and training modules that facilitate knowledge transfer in the field of machining. The focus is on fostering expertise in the utilization and maintenance of these tools, ensuring that individuals are equipped with the necessary skills to operate and innovate within the mechanical engineering sector. This classification serves as a framework for categorizing training and further education opportunities related to machine tools and tooling techniques.

this classification encompasses devices and systems specifically designed for the training and further development of skills related to engines and machinery. It includes various types of engines and machines that serve educational purposes, enhancing knowledge and practical experience in mechanical engineering. The focus is on facilitating learning in the operation, maintenance, and innovation of machinery, ensuring that users can gain hands-on experience in a controlled environment. This classification is distinct from others that address different aspects of mechanical engineering, such as components related to lubrication, propulsion, and automation technologies, emphasizing its unique role in educational settings.

preferred_name.label: Construction machine, agricultural machinery (training, further training)

definition.text: this category encompasses machinery and equipment specifically designed for construction and agricultural applications, aimed at enhancing knowledge and skills through training and further education. It includes various types of machines utilized in the construction industry, such as earth movers, excavators, and cranes, as well as agricultural machinery like tractors and harvesters. The focus is on educational programs and resources that provide practical and theoretical insights into the operation, maintenance, and management of these machines. This classification is distinct from other categories related to mechanical engineering and technology, which cover different aspects of machine components, propulsion, and automation technologies. The emphasis is on fostering expertise in the specific operational and technical aspects of construction and agricultural machinery.

this classification encompasses education and training related to the specialized field of fine mechanics, focusing on the precision and intricacies involved in mechanical engineering. It includes programs and courses aimed at enhancing the skills and knowledge of individuals engaged in designing, manufacturing, and maintaining finely-tuned mechanical systems. The offerings may cover various topics such as advanced assembly techniques, precision measurement, and the application of intricate mechanical principles. This classification is distinct from other areas of mechanical engineering training, which address broader or differing topics related to machinery, components, and automation technologies. The aim is to equip learners with the expertise necessary to excel in fine mechanics and contribute effectively to the mechanical engineering sector.

preferred_name.label: Apparatus engineering, tank construction and tool-making (trng., further trng.)

definition.text: this classification encompasses educational programs and advanced learning opportunities focused on the design, construction, and maintenance of apparatuses and tanks, as well as the art and science of tool-making. It addresses the specialized knowledge and skills required for professionals working in sectors related to mechanical engineering, emphasizing practical and theoretical training. The content of these programs may cover various aspects, including materials selection, manufacturing processes, safety standards, and innovative techniques in construction and tooling. The aim is to equip individuals with the competencies necessary to excel in the engineering field, particularly in areas that require precision and technical expertise in apparatus and tank engineering, along with advanced tool-making practices.

this classification encompasses educational programs and resources focused on the principles and applications of robotics and handling technologies. It includes training and further training initiatives that aim to enhance skills related to the design, operation, and maintenance of robotic systems and automated handling solutions. The offerings may cover a range of topics, including programming, system integration, and the use of various robotic technologies in industrial and commercial settings. Emphasis is placed on practical knowledge and hands-on experience, enabling individuals to effectively work with and innovate in the field of robotics and automation. This classification distinguishes itself from other areas of mechanical engineering education by specifically targeting the unique aspects of robotic handling and automation technologies.

this classification pertains to services focused on managing financial interests, specifically those related to interest rates and their associated financial instruments. It encompasses a range of activities aimed at optimizing financial performance through strategic financial products. Services in this category facilitate the management of cash flows, risk mitigation, and investment returns through various techniques and instruments. The offerings include agreements and contracts designed to either secure future interest rates or provide financial leverage through loans and investments. This classification is distinct from other financial services that deal with insurance, fund allocation, donations, sponsorships, or external accounting. It plays a crucial role in the financial landscape, enabling entities to navigate interest rate fluctuations and enhance their financial stability and growth.

a financial service providing a specific arrangement where one party borrows funds from another, typically a financial institution, with the obligation to repay the principal amount along with interest over a predetermined period. This arrangement facilitates access to capital for various purposes, such as personal needs, business operations, or investments. The terms of the loan, including interest rates, repayment schedules, and collateral requirements, are defined in a contractual agreement, allowing borrowers to manage their financial obligations effectively. This service is distinct from various related financial instruments and products that focus on different aspects of interest management.

a financial service that involves an account specifically designed for the purpose of managing and earning interest on monetary investments. This account typically allows for the deposit of funds, which can accrue interest over time, providing a means for individuals or organizations to grow their financial resources. Such accounts may come with various features, including different interest rates, terms of withdrawal, and minimum balance requirements, enabling users to choose options that best meet their financial goals. The primary focus is on the effective management of interest income derived from the invested capital.

a financial service that involves the sale of accounts receivable to a third party at a discount in order to obtain immediate cash. This process is often used by businesses to improve cash flow, manage credit risk, and finance operations. The entity purchasing the receivables assumes the responsibility for collecting the debts, while the seller receives quick access to funds without waiting for payment from customers. This service is commonly utilized by companies that require liquidity to support ongoing operations or to invest in growth opportunities, providing a strategic alternative to traditional financing methods.

hedging related to interest management refers to financial strategies and instruments designed to mitigate the risk associated with fluctuations in interest rates. This includes various mechanisms that allow parties to protect themselves from potential losses that may arise due to changes in prevailing interest rates. The focus is on reducing exposure to interest rate volatility, thereby ensuring more predictable financial outcomes. This category encompasses a range of financial products and services that facilitate risk management in the context of interest rate changes, allowing entities to stabilize their cash flows and optimize their financial performance.

a financial service that allows individuals or organizations to deposit money for safekeeping while earning interest over time. This type of account is specifically designed for managing interest-related transactions and activities. It provides features that facilitate the tracking and calculation of interest earnings, enabling users to optimize their financial strategies. The service may include various functions such as interest rate adjustments, balance inquiries, and transaction monitoring, catering to the needs of those who seek to manage their financial assets effectively. This service is distinct from other financial instruments that focus on different aspects of interest management.

this category encompasses financial services related to the management of dividends, which are distributions of a portion of a company's earnings to its shareholders. The focus is on strategies and solutions that facilitate the effective handling and optimization of dividend income, ensuring compliance with regulatory frameworks and enhancing financial performance. This classification differentiates itself from other interest management services by specifically addressing the nuances of dividend distribution, reinvestment strategies, and tax implications associated with receiving dividends. It supports investors and companies in maximizing their returns through informed decision-making regarding dividend policies and management practices.

this classification encompasses services focused on the technical aspects of development within the information and communication sector. It includes a variety of activities that support the creation, modification, and implementation of technology solutions. The services aim to enhance functionality, performance, and user experience through tailored programming and system customization. Additionally, it covers the evaluation processes necessary to assess technology effectiveness, as well as the implementation of both hardware and software components. The classification also involves the production of multimedial content and the acquisition, collection, and treatment of information relevant to technical products. Furthermore, it includes the generation of comprehensive technical documentation and conceptual design services that guide the development process, ensuring alignment with user requirements and industry standards.

a specialized service focused on the creation, modification, and optimization of software applications and systems. This encompasses a range of activities including coding, debugging, and integrating software components to meet specific user requirements. It may involve various programming languages and frameworks, ensuring that the end product is functional, efficient, and aligns with industry standards. This service is distinct from other offerings that involve system customization, evaluation, hardware or software deployment, multimedia production, content management, technical documentation, and conceptual design, as it is primarily centered on the technical aspects of software development and engineering.

keywords.label: Creation of system specifications (program creation IT)
Software programming
Specification sheet and system specifications for IT systems
Concept creation and help (IT)
Logic (program creation IT)
Technical specifications (program creation IT)

definition.text: a specialized service focused on tailoring products or solutions to meet specific user requirements or preferences. This service often involves modifying existing systems or creating bespoke configurations that enhance functionality, usability, or performance. It may encompass activities such as adjusting software interfaces, integrating various components to work seamlessly together, and ensuring that the end product aligns with the client's unique operational needs. This process often requires collaboration with clients to gather detailed specifications and feedback throughout the customization process.

this category encompasses services related to the systematic assessment and analysis of various information technology systems, products, or processes. It includes activities designed to determine the effectiveness, efficiency, and overall quality of IT solutions, ensuring they meet specified requirements and standards. This classification incorporates the evaluation of software applications, IT infrastructure, and associated methodologies, providing insights that guide decision-making and improvements. The services offered may involve testing, reviewing, and auditing of IT components, contributing to enhanced performance and compliance within the technological landscape.

this classification pertains to the provision of services that focus on the tangible execution of technical solutions through the integration and deployment of hardware components. It encompasses activities related to the installation, configuration, and optimization of physical devices, ensuring that they function effectively within specified technical environments. This classification distinguishes itself by emphasizing the practical aspects of hardware deployment as opposed to software-related services or theoretical design processes. It is essential for ensuring that systems are operational and meet the performance criteria set forth in project specifications, thereby facilitating the seamless operation of technological infrastructures.

this classification encompasses services focused on the deployment and integration of software solutions tailored to meet specific organizational needs. It involves the systematic application of methodologies and tools to ensure that software systems are effectively implemented within the operational environment of a business. The activities may include project planning, resource allocation, user training, and the configuration of software applications to align with client requirements. This classification distinguishes itself from other related services by emphasizing the practical aspects of software utilization, ensuring that the software not only functions as intended but also enhances overall productivity and efficiency in the workplace.

a category that encompasses services related to the creation, production, and management of multimedia content within the information technology sector. This includes activities such as the design and development of audio-visual materials, interactive media, and other digital content that integrates various forms of media, including text, images, graphics, sound, and video. The focus is on enhancing user experience and engagement through innovative multimedia solutions, which may involve collaboration with clients to tailor content to specific needs and objectives. This category specifically distinguishes itself from other related services by emphasizing the unique aspects of multimedia production and management.

this category encompasses services related to the procurement, gathering, and processing of information or content within the realm of information technology. It includes activities aimed at identifying, sourcing, and organizing data or content to enhance usability and accessibility. The focus is on methodologies and tools that facilitate the systematic collection, curation, and treatment of digital or non-digital assets. These services may involve various techniques for data management, ensuring that the content is relevant, accurate, and structured appropriately for use in IT applications. This classification is distinct from other related services that focus on software development, customization, evaluation, or hardware configurations.

definition.text: Service for the creation of manuals, paperworks and tutorials about technical products, components, machines and IT or communication solutions

a category that encompasses services related to the formulation and visualization of ideas, plans, and frameworks for information technology solutions. This involves creating theoretical models and structures that guide the development of software and systems, focusing on the integration of user requirements and technical specifications. The emphasis is on innovation and creativity, ensuring that the conceptual framework aligns with business objectives and technological capabilities. This category is distinct from other offerings that involve direct programming, system customization, hardware or software implementation, multimedia production, content management, or technical documentation. It serves as a foundational step in the development process, aimed at establishing a clear vision for subsequent technical activities.
